Job Title: VP - Site Reliability Engineer - Public Cloud (Hybrid)
Job description:
Job Id: 23640761
Citi’s Operations & Technology organization (O&T) is driving an innovative Cloud First strategy that works to optimize the IT environment, reduce complexity, and implement high degrees of automation to enable more agile application delivery. We aim to give Citi businesses a competitive edge by leveraging cloud scale architectures and enabling new infrastructure economics. EIO&T operates as a technology company focused on implementing scalable and innovative next gen technology solutions that will shape the future of global banking.
At Citi we know how important reliability is for our customers. Our Site Reliability Engineers bring drive and determination every day to make sure our customers get the best possible experience interacting with our technology services. In this role as a Site Reliability Engineer in our Public Cloud group, you will be working on complex and difficult technical problems solving for scale, performance and availability. The ideal candidate has experience gained in a software development environment and a deep appreciation of best practice for the design and deployment of fault tolerance solutions for cloud platforms. You will have either worked closely with, or as part of a technology Operations team and have an understanding of demands and challenges of that domain.
Responsibilities:

Job description:
Senior Engineer, Enterprise Security

We’re living in exciting times. We want to use technology to rethink how financial services are offered. Grab and Singapore Telecommunications together have recently applied for a digital full banking license in Singapore as a consortium (Grab 60%, Singtel 40%). As Grab and SingTel come together, we have big dreams to unlock the potential of financial inclusion in the region we live in. We want to build a digital bank on the right foundation - using data, tech and trust to solve problems and serve customers. We would love to speak with you if you believe you have what it takes to be at the forefront of innovation to build this new Digibank with us.

Get to know the Team:

Our Corporate IT Team within GXS Technology Services (internal IT) aims to be a technology leader that provides predictive and seamless experiences to all GXS employees. We are a diverse team of technology practitioners looking to outserve fellow employees with positive, personalized IT experiences. We are looking for individuals with similar customer-centric and innovative values to join our growing team.

Get to know the Role:

The incumbent plays an important IT management role that is essential to GXS in ensuring up to date security systems for the business.

You are expected to:
Driving value for GXS finding the opportunities by proactively working together with other internal IT or business stakeholders, creating solutions that add value, delivering and supporting them with excellenceBe the champion and evangelist of security capabilities within Enterprise Technology and with key stakeholder functions.Contribute to the execution of IT governance and compliance processes and proceduresParticipating in security project deliveries, efficiently working with Project managers.Work jointly with the Security team in security incident response.Work jointly with the Security team for detection and/or prevention system and network against virus, malware, spam, zero-day vulnerabilities and cyber threats.Administration on security systems.

The must haves:
Solid PowerShell / Shell / Bash scripting skills.Possess experience in security solutions such as Endpoint Security, Firewalls, VPN, SIEM, IDS/IPS, WAF and malware protection systems.Equipped with an analytical mind, innovative ideas and robust troubleshooting skills.At least 3 yrs of administration experience in Windows / Linux / MacOS families on Cloud (AWS or Azure) and networking.Excellent soft skills - able to handle pressure in a fast-paced environment. Open-minded, creative and innovative.

Really nice to haves skills
Savvy ITIL knowledge.Software developer background in areas - Python, JavaScript, or Node.js.Certifications in CISSP, ECSA, CEH, CISM, CISA, CPTC and/or CPTEMonitoring knowledge on various monitoring tools (DataDog, CloudWatch etc);

Job description:
Next-gen operations at scale, with pure Python infra-as-code, from bare metal to containers and applications. Our goal is to perfect enterprise infrastructure devops.
We run hundreds of private cloud, Kubernetes, and application clusters for customers across physical and public cloud estate, and we are raising the bar on what's possible with automation by embracing a universal operator pattern and model-driven operations.
To succeed in this role you need to believe in automation as a pure software engineering problem, not a hack-it-till-it-works-for-me problem. You need to be interested in the scientific approach to operations at scale, driven by metrics and code, and you need to be able to learn the entire stack, from bare metal networking and kernel up to serverless and open source applications.
Cloud Operations Engineer
Our cloud operations engineers bring Python software-engineering skills and rigour to the operations domain. We practice devsecops from bare metal to application. We architect and run OpenStack, Kubernetes and software defined storage, and we enable devsecops for applications running on that infrastructure too.
To become a member of this team, you need to be a software engineer fluent in Python, you need a genuine interest in the full open source infrastructure stack from metal to containers, and you need the ability to work in a high pressure operations environment with mission-critical services for global brand name customers.
As a member of the team you will gain experience in a broad range of cloud technologies. We evolve our offerings as the state of the art improves, so you get to stay current with the latest capabilities in open source infrastructure. We drive upgrades to keep our customers on the latest, best solutions.
What Canonical Offers
Technical management team that understands the details of what we are developingA culture of openness and inclusivenessHelpful and talented engineers who are world-class experts in many fieldsTeams focused on good work life balance with long average retention ratesA wide range of engineering disciplines and career paths that can move between divisionsFully remote company for career growth without relocation requirements
Requirements
Software Engineering or Computer Science degreeLinux experience and familiarity with Linux networking and storagePython software development experienceDemonstrated drive for continual learningDevops experience
Nice to haves
Experience with OpenStack or Kubernetes deployment or operationsWe hope that you'll join us in helping to shape and build the future of free software together
Of course we also offer...
Learning and DevelopmentAnnual Compensation ReviewRecognition RewardsAnnual LeavePriority Pass for travelFlexible working option
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.
#stack

Job description:
Airwallex is the leading financial technology platform for modern businesses growing beyond borders. With one of the world’s most powerful payments and banking infrastructure, our technology empowers businesses of all sizes to accept payments, move money globally, and simplify their financial operations, all in one single platform.
Established in 2015, our purpose is to connect entrepreneurs, business builders, makers and creators with opportunities in every corner of the world. Today, Airwallex has a global footprint across Asia-Pacific, Europe, and North America.
As a staff DevOps engineer in the issuing platform team, you will be responsible for leading the design of our DevOps strategy, and working closely with cross-functional teams to develop and evolve the cloud infrastructure optimized for performance, scalability and security in order to support our next 10x growth.
Your focus will be around building a globally distributed, PCI DSS compliant platform using GCP and Kubenetes, whilst guiding and upskilling internal teams using best practices for building, deployment and scaling applications in the cloud. As we are a Financial Service company, security is at the core of our practices and automation.
You will bring to the team a level of expertise in operational platform management, developing observability and detection capabilities that will decrease time to discover problems and allow our teams to increase stability and not sacrifice agility or security.
A key aspect of this position will be building consensus amongst DevOps Engineers across geographies in different feature teams about the tools and practices we use, and evolving that consensus into agreed standards.
Who You Are
You are committed – You strive to produce, exceptional, risk free, fully tested solutions in all the platforms you build.You can think on your feet - with experience building platforms which resolve fast paced, ever changing success measures.You are team player – you enjoy working in a collaborative, innovative and customer first driven environment.You are naturally curious – always asking why to better understand our customer needsYou are a passionate problem solver – You love digging deep and brainstorming with colleagues in order to come up with the best solution for a problem
What You’ll Bring
Technical leadership of software design in meeting requirements of service stability, reliability, scalability and security.The expertise to design, analyze and troubleshoot large-scale distributed systems.Demonstrates innovative methods of declaratively automating cloud-based IaaS/PaaS deployments and applications using modern and innovative GitOps and DevOps techniques and technologies.A love for operational metrics including MTTD & MTTR and the capabilities and practices that allow these to be continually improved upon.A strong passion for automation and repeatable processes.Deep exposure to public cloud (GCP, AWS or Azure), Docker and Kubernetes.Experience working with a mainstream programming language such as Java, Go, Python or Rust.Broad experience with modern CI/CD pipelines ( Gitlab, Jenkins, Argo etc).A fervent enthusiasm for infrastructure-as-code ( we love Terraform).Observability tooling such as Splunk, NewRelic, Prometheus, Grafana.Excellent understanding of OS, platform and network security practices, patterns and frameworks.Network topology and infrastructure architectures on Linux based platforms.
At Airwallex you’ll have the ability to make an impact in a rapidly growing, global fintech. We want you to share in our success, which is why you’ll be offered a competitive salary plus valuable equity within Airwallex. We also like to ensure we create the best environment for our people by providing a collaborative open office space with a fully stocked kitchen. We organise regular team building events and we give our people the freedom to be creative.
Airwallex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and anyone seeking employment at Airwallex is considered based on merit, qualifications, competence and talent. We don’t regard colour, religion, race, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry, citizenship, sex, marital or family status, disability, gender, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
Airwallex does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms/recruiters. Airwallex will not pay any fees to search firms/recruiters if a candidate is submitted by a search firm/recruiter unless an agreement has been entered into with respect to specific open position(s). Search firms/recruiters submitting resumes to Airwallex on an unsolicited basis shall be deemed to accept this condition, regardless of any other provision to the contrary.

Job description:
About The Team
Our SRE (Site Reliability Engineer) team is driven by a clear mission: to enhance system availability and scalability. By blending the expertise of software development and system operations, we are uniquely positioned to tackle the challenges of maintaining large-scale distributed systems. We aim to construct a robust e-commerce infrastructure that can seamlessly handle the demands of a rapidly evolving marketplace. Furthermore, we are dedicated to creating an efficient SRE ecosystem that optimizes every aspect of our operations, ensuring a smooth and reliable experience for our users.
Job Description
Responsible for researching, designing, and developing cutting-edge computer and network software, as well as specialized utility programs. This role involves ensuring efficient, effective, and innovative software solutions to meet organizational and user needs.Tasked with understanding and analyzing system requirements, this role leverages principles and techniques from computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis to develop tailored software solutions. The position ensures that software functionalities align with system requirements while maintaining technical excellence.Responsible for updating and enhancing current software functionalities, this role focuses on continuous improvement of software performance and continuous delivery efficiency. Collaborating closely with computer hardware engineers, this role focuses on the seamless integration of hardware and software systems. The position is also responsible for developing clear specifications and performance requirements to ensure efficient and optimized system performance.
Requirements
Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis or related fields.More than 5 years of relevant working experience.Extensive and hands-on knowledge of Linux operating systems (Ubuntu, CentOS, etc.).Extensive experience in Kubernetes development or operations.Strong knowledge of Computer Networks (TCP/IP, DNS, etc.), Computer Organisations, and OS.Hands-on experience with at least one of the scripting/programming languages: Python, Go.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to thrive under difficult and stressful situations.Passionate and a high sense of responsibility for work.Fast learning ability and a good team player.Detailed-oriented, cautious, and prudent.
Preferred Experience
Experience in Service Mesh solutions.Experience in traffic scheduling solutions, e.g. Nginx, APISix, OpenResty.Experience in eBPF.Experience in large-scale project management, demonstrating expertise in overseeing multifaceted tasks, coordinating cross-functional teams, and ensuring timely and successful project delivery.
Skills: Mathematical Analysis:Problem Solving:Programming:Python (Programming Language):Scripting:Software Solutions:Stressful Situations:System Performance:Systems Analysis

Job Title: Cloud Engineer | 5+ Yrs Experience | Up to $8,000
Job description:
Why should you join the team?
If you aim to be a "Full Stack Infrastructure Engineer", on any cloud or platform. While you will still excel in your core skill.If you want to be a part of next big change, instead of being a witness.If you are the one who can challenge the established ways of working.If you seek to 'innovate and operate' as a single team.If you are looking to work in an agile, outcome driven organisation, not just limited to metrics and numbers.
What We Think You 'should' Know
Experience with at least one of IaaS cloud providers: AWS, Azure, Google, Softlayer, OpenStackHands on experience with *NIX operating system flavors' (Redhat, Ubuntu, Suseand UNIX).A good grasp of internet and networking elements such as TCP/IP, HTTP and DNS, routing,switching, firewall etc.Must have an understanding of low-level Linux operating systems concepts, kernel, block device, memory management, drivers, syslog.Experience with Linux Kernel level troubleshooting.Experience with at least one configuration management tool (Ansible, Puppet, Chef).Beginner to Intermediate level shell scripting.
What You ‘must’ Have
Hands on experience with delivering 2-3 cloud buildprojects/engagementsExpert/Professional level Certification on at least one public cloud provider (AWS/Azure/GCP)
Your Roles And Responsibilities
Azure/AWS Infrastructure SME should have a minimum experience level of 5-7 years, with evidence of exposure to Azure/AWS logical constructs such as Enterprise enrolments, Subscriptions, and Resource GroupsAzure/AWS Infrastructure (network, compute, storage, availability designs) deployment projects during this timeDeploying Enterprise solutions of varying complexity on Azure/AWS cloud platforms in 1 or more regionsAzure/AWS integration aspects for hybrid solutions such as WAN networking, ExpressRoute, VPN, B2B, B2C, Active Directory, etc.Knowledge of cloud-native and 3rd party tools for management, monitoring security and automationAutomation and orchestration tools knowledge such as ARM, Chef, Puppet, Terraform, Ansible, etc, as well as scripting skills such as PowerShell, JSON, YAML,Detailed design document writing at a suitable standard for medium complexity and higher projectsChange management aspects and service management knowledge,Completing testing programs, checks and procedures, hand over to production etc.Experience of upgrades, consolidation, and new deployments.Azure fundamentals/AWS associate certification as a minimumKnowledge and Certification on one or more other cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, OCI) is desirable
How To Apply
If you are a team player, meticulous & organized, and more importantly, believe that YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE, we would like to hear from you. Simply submit your application with your updated Resume in MS Word Format to Then Eugene (EA Personnel Reg. No.: R22104742) by clicking the ‘Apply’link.
Please Indicate The Below Information In Your Resume
Current & Expected salaryReason(s) for leavingNotice Period / Availability to commence work

Job description:
Position Overview

As a software development engineering intern, you will join Autodesk Localization team responsible for empowering global customers by delivering quality localized solutions. You will work on migration of Continuous Localization (CL) project from Jenkins pipeline to software application, where you will contribute to designing and developing APIs for CL. You will also be responsible for deploying the application to AWS infrastructure using different services.

Responsibilities
Use agile methodologies to develop REST APIs for Continuous Localization applicationParticipate in the complete software development life cycle, from design to testing and deploymentDesign and implement efficient database models, queries, and integration using SQL or ORM frameworksIntegrate RESTful services to facilitate communication between different application componentsEnsure the performance, security, and reliability of applications through debugging, testing, and optimizationContribute to the documentation of technical specifications and user guidesAssist in code reviews, identify opportunities for codebase enhancement, and adhere to coding best practices
Minimum Qualifications
You must be enrolled in a full-time Bachelor's or Master’s in Computer Science or Computing Engineering or other relevant fieldsHave a passion for programming, and building resilient APIsBe someone who enjoys working collaboratively in a team with high trust
Preferred Qualifications
Working knowledge of programming languages like Python or JavaSolid understanding of object-oriented design principlesExperience with AWSExperience with REST API developmentBasic understanding of version control systems like GitBasic knowledge of web technologies including HTML, CSS, and JavaScriptEagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and toolsHave excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detailEffective communication skills and the ability to work in a team environmentHands on experience on docker is a plus
Learning Benefits
Students will get experience of agile (scrum) SDLC through day-to-day workGain hands-on experience in a professional development environmentMentorship and guidance from experienced software developersOpportunity to work on real projects with meaningful impactNetworking opportunities with professionals in the industryPotential for full-time employment consideration after successful completion of the internship
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Autodesk has always valued flexibility in how we work. We continue to provide employees flexibility to support their work preferences wherever possible and nearly all roles are hybrid or remote, unless otherwise indicated.

Job description:
Software Engineer Internship (Singapore)
Candidates should be interested in working in Singapore for their full-time job after graduation.
About The Role
Our software engineering internship is an intensive 10-week experience within our core development team that designs, codes, tests, and maintains our distributed trading system.
You will learn the fundamentals of a large-scale, high-performance infrastructure; sharpen your C++ programming skills; and see what it’s like to work as a full-time software engineer at Jump. Throughout your internship you will take on projects targeted for production, which go through our full-cycle process for development, testing, and release using Agile methodologies. May include other duties as assigned or needed.
You will be working side by side with our experienced software engineers and you’ll receive ongoing feedback and coaching from a dedicated mentor throughout the summer.
Our internship program is the primary way we identify top young software engineers for our core development team, and it’s a proven path for earning full-time opportunities at Jump.
Qualifications/Requirements
Experience with C++ programming on Linux preferred Strong understanding of data structures and threading modelsAbility to work with a team in a fast-paced environment, deploying new software dailyPassion for solving complex problems and learning to build optimal solutions from scratch, instead of simply assembling things from existing librariesInterest in using knowledge from several areas -- such as hardware, networking, OS design -- to produce extremely high-performance softwareReliable and predictable availability No finance or economics study or work experience required
Also Helpful, But Not Required
Past internship or job experience in a software development role is a plusAdvanced coursework in algorithms, network programming, operating systems, compilers
Skills: Data Structures

Job description:
As a Senior DevOps Engineer at EMQ2, you will work on projects that impact the lives of many. From Enterprise Login and Payment Gateways to Training and Learning Management Systems, over 1,000,000 users will be using your systems. We are looking for people with passion and grit to grow and learn with us.
As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role in ensuring smooth and efficient application deployment, infrastructure management, and maintenance processes. You will collaborate closely with the development team, ensuring the successful setup of applications in our on-premise database and providing support for their CI/CD pipeline. Additionally, you will be responsible for performing regular maintenance tasks and assisting various teams in meeting their infrastructure needs.
You Will Be
 Set up applications in the on-premise database environment, ensuring optimal performance and scalability. Collaborate with development teams to create and enhance CI/CD pipelines for efficient application deployment. Implement and manage infrastructure-as-code solutions for different teams, ensuring their infrastructure needs are met. Perform regular maintenance tasks, including monitoring, backup management, security patches deployment and system upgrades. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to application deployment, infrastructure, and performance. Develop and maintain documentation related to infrastructure, deployment processes, and best practices. Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in the DevOps field, identifying opportunities for process improvements and automation.
The Ideal Candidate Should Have The Following
 Proven experience as a DevOps Engineer or similar role, with a focus on on-premise application setup and infrastructure support. Strong understanding of on-premise database systems, such as Oracle, SQL Server, or MySQL. Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools, such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or CircleCI. Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Bash, Python, PowerShell) for automation tasks. Experience with configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Chef) for managing infrastructure. Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Solid understanding of networking principles and security best practices. Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to analyze complex issues and provide effective solutions. Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Microsoft Certified: Azure DevOps Engineer) are a plus. Great organizational, planning, and problem-solving skills Great interpersonal, collaborating and team playing skills
The Ideal Candidate Should Be
 Resourceful and independent Meticulous and detail-oriented Self-motivated, self-driven and strong initiative Ability to grow, learn and manage more responsibility over time Ability to immerse into company culture is a bonus

Location: Singapore, SG
Company: ST Engineering Group
Job Req ID: 2196
As a Cloud DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible to deploy and configure solutions in the cloud (Public, Hybrid, Private). You automate cloud operations, develop infrastructure automation scripts and participate in the continuous improvement of cloud solutions. You participate in the specification, setup and runs Proof of Concepts (PoC) and demonstrations. You define and deploy monitoring, metrics, and logging systems. You administer and maintain servers across virtual platforms and leverages COTS and/ or open source solutions to automate tasks. You create and improve procedures and author technical documentation to enable self-service for most operational tasks.
You are meticulous in your approach, possess inventiveness and attention to detail that aids in the development of solutions. You have the ability to understand the business requirements and propose affordable and feasible solutions.
Responsibilities
Define requirements
Liaise with stakeholders to understand business needs and technical requirements
Analyze existing infrastructure components for potential migration to the cloud
Research emerging cloud and infrastructure technologies and IAC (Infra-as-a-Code)
Participate in technology assessments
Develop cloud solutions
Support the development and gap analysis of cloud-based DevOps solutions
Develop system and service deployment scripts
Test cloud-based solutions using specialized infrastructure tools, techniques and virtualization technologies
Develop automated processes to prevent, identify and fix problems and IAC (Infra-as-a-Code)
Implement cloud solutions
Implementation of Cloud Native DevOps OR Cloud DevOps solutions and IAC (Infra-as-a-Code)
Tune systems to ensure optimal performance
Monitor metrics around reliability, stability and performance of cloud infrastructure after implementation
Assist with the integration of third party technologies into cloud infrastructure
Maintain cloud solutions
Assist with preparation and maintenance of operational and technical documentation
Perform cloud infrastructure monitoring
Identify areas of improvement to help streamline operations
Provide cloud infrastructure support to users
Troubleshoot system issues and failures
Requirements
Minimum of 2-5 years of experience. You have Cloud DevOps experience on Amazon AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Cloud: Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, PaaS, IaaS, SaaS products and solutions
Platforms and tools: Jenkins, Artifactory, Python, other scripting languages and etc.
DevOps/Automation: Terraform IAC, OpsWorks, CloudFormation, Ansible, Chef, Puppet, and etc.
Security: Identity management, security monitoring, various compliance frameworks, and a deep understanding of core security concepts and processes as it relates to securing Cloud technologies
Consulting and Soft Skills: Business Needs Analysis, Emerging Technology Synthesis, Stakeholder Management
Cloud DevOps Proficiency in one of the clouds AWS, Azure and Google Cloud Platform and Tech stack proficiency (CI/CD) in Infrastructure Deployment, Infrastructure Design, Infrastructure Support, Network Administration and Maintenance, Network Configuration,

Cloud Engineer (DevOps)

Our mission is to be the trusted source of news on Singapore and Asia, to represent the communities that make up Singapore, and to connect them to the world.

It has several business segments in the media industry, including the publishing of newspapers, magazines, and books in both print and digital editions. It also owns and operates other businesses including radio stations and outdoor media.

In This Role, You Can Expect To
Design and implement cloud infrastructure to support both internal and external facing services and applications across multiple cloud service providers.Define and implement best practices around Cloud Service Provider configurations and security.Define and implement best practices around infrastructure and application monitoring, and responding to incidents.Work with automation extensively to manage infrastructure on the cloud using Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform and to automate internal processes such as GitHub CI/CD pipelines.Work with cloud native tools and technologies such as Kubernetes, containers, and Terraform among others.Contribute to both internal and external open source projects.
You May Be a Good Fit If
You hold a degree in Computer Science or Information Systems.You have at least 3-5 years of practitioner experience in DevOps/SRE and cloud technologies.You have deep knowledge of cloud service providers and best practices around implementation and configuration, preferably managing AWS.Good knowledge of and ability to make use of most of the AWS resources such as EC2, RDS, ALB, Code Pipeline, ElastiCache, Auto-scaling Group, S3, VPC, IAM, EKS, ECS, CloudFront, Route53, CloudWatch, LambdaYou have experience with and are passionate about Infrastructure as Code, automation, and developing solutions that help developers move quickly and safely.You are proficient in cloud-native technology and tools, including Kubernetes, containers, and Terraform.You are confident, proactive, organized, with strong communication ability and a willingness to work with a multidisciplinary team.You are prepared to go outside your comfort zone with a strong growth mind-set.You have prior experience with software engineering, including the ability to code and test in one or more programming languages, and debugging software
Cloud, AWS, DevOps

Job Title: Expression of Interest: Senior DevOps Engineer
Job description:
We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.
The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:
Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.
The F4S Talent Pool process:
Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.
About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)
Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high performing teams.
Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.

Job Title: Customer Engineer, Business Application Platform, Google Cloud
Job description:
Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.

Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.8 years of experience as a technical sales engineer in a cloud computing environment or in a customer-facing role.Experience with web services and API technologies (e.g., HTTP, SOAP, REST, etc.).

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.Experience with legacy and modern application development, container orchestration systems, and middleware technologies.Experience in areas such as API management, application integration (iPaaS), security, and PaaS.Knowledge of Google Cloud, multi/hybrid-cloud strategies, and associated technologies.Knowledge of security and API security technologies (e.g., OAuth, mTLS, SAML, JWT, SSO, etc.).

About The Job

When leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.

In this role, you will help shape the future of businesses to use technology to connect with customers, employees, and partners. You will help prospective and existing customers and partners understand Google Cloud, develop creative cloud solutions and architectures to solve their business challenges, and solve any potential technical roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

Provide API management, Application Integration, Security, and other application modernization expertise to support the technical relationship with Google’s customers.Work with the account team to identify, qualify business opportunities, understand key customer requirements, and develop a strategy to achieve technical goals.Develop proofs of concepts, presentations, and demos with a clear plan to take a prospect successfully through the evaluation process.Partner directly with product management to prioritize solutions impacting customers to Google Cloud.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Job Title: Customer Engineer, Infrastructure Modernization, Google Cloud
Job description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.4 years of experience working in IT strategy.Experience in planning infrastructure modernization as a technical consultant, technical pre-sales engineer, or enterprise architect.Experience as an enterprise architect in a cloud computing environment or customer-facing role.

Preferred qualifications:

Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.Experience in networking (e.g., Linux, software-defined networking, network virtualization, open protocols, application acceleration and load balancing, Domain Name System (DNS), virtual private networks) and their application to PaaS and IaaS technologies.Experience in architecting and developing software or infrastructure for scalable and secure distributed systems.Experience with containers and associated technologies including Docker, Kubernetes, Istio, Serverless, and Microservices.Experience with application development concepts and technologies (e.g., CI/CD, Java, Python, Chef, Puppet, Ansible).

About The Job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Customer Engineer, you will work with technical Sales teams as a machine learning subject matter expert to differentiate Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners understand the power of Google Cloud, explain technical features, help customers design architectures, and problem-solve any potential roadblocks.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

Guide customers and peers to solve difficult problems with innovative and novel solutions, leveraging an excellent set of technical competencies.Manage the technical relationship with Google customers, including managing product and solution briefings, proof-of-concept work, and the coordination of additional technical resources.Work with the team to identify and qualify business opportunities, identify key customer technical objections, and develop a strategy to resolve technical blockers.Recommend migration strategies, enterprise architectures, migration tools, and cloud infrastructure to implement a complete solution using best practices on Google Cloud.Travel to customer sites, conferences, and other related events as needed.

Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Job Title: Infrastructure Solution Engineer (Microsoft produts / Azure / Lync, Up to $5500, East)
Job description:
Your Role
We are looking for an experienced Infrastructure Solution Engineer who is an IT professional well versed in the field of Microsoft Products such as Active Directory, Exchange Servers, Microsoft Lync Server etc. You will help in accomplishing in High Availability solution such as Failover Clustering, Network and DNS load balancing.
What Will You Do
Able to work as a Deployment Engineer in a Project Team specialized in Microsoft products (Active Directory, Exchange Servers, Microsoft Virtualization Hyper-V, O365, Azure).To perform deploying, Migration, Configuration and Implementation of Microsoft Active Directory Infrastructure, Microsoft Exchange Servers, Microsoft Lync Servers, and Microsoft Hyper-V Virtualization.To provide solution for the Microsoft Active Directory, Exchange Server and Lync Server to the enterprise customers.To migrate Active Directory, upgrade and deploy High Availability Solution.To migrate Microsoft Exchange Servers from Different Email Platforms such as Lotus Notes, Transition between the Exchange Platforms, High Availability Implementation such as Fail over clustering (Exchange 2010\Exchange 2013\Exchange 2016\Exchange 2019 DAG, Exchange 2007 CCR, SCR, SCC failover clustering).
What Do We Want
At least a Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Science, Information Technology, or any relevant degree.At least 2 years of working experience in Microsoft technologies especially hands-on experience in cross-forest Active Directory migration, on-premises Microsoft Exchange and Office 365 migration projects.Having a Microsoft certification such as MCSE or MCP: Microsoft Exchange or Office 365 will be advantageous Proven experience in deployment and testing of endpoints, Office 365 services, Active Directory Federation Services, and modern authentications.Overall Office 365 security expertise including strong knowledge of Azure Active Directory, Azure Information Protection, Information Rights Management, sign-on and multi-factor authentication, and Microsoft Enterprise Mobility + Security.Must have experience in analyzing, troubleshooting, and providing solutions for Active Directory, Exchange, Office 365 related issues.Must have experience in Deploying Microsoft Active Directory, Exchange Servers (2000/2003/2007/2010/2016/2019), O365, Microsoft Lync Server, and Unified Communication.

Job description:
⚡ Cloud Engineer - Infrastructure & Deployment - MLOps Technology 🌎 Singapore💼 Permanent role💰 Competitive Salary + Flexibility
Our client is an MLOps solutions company that is revolutionizing the deep-learning landscape withtheir end-to-end platform that enables rapid model training and deployment. Their platform has beenembraced by over 6,000+ users spanning 53 countries, empowering them to address a widerange of challenges in various industries, such as crop grading and manufacturing optimizationto disease identification through MRI scans etc.
As a pivotal team member, you will be responsible in designing, implementing, and maintainingof highly secure and dependable cloud-based systems customized for government and militaryusers with air-gapped requisites. Your proficiency in Python, Terraform, and other Infrastructureas Code (IaC) tools will be pivotal in overseeing cloud environments across diverse platforms,including AWS, GCP, and Azure.
Your in-depth grasp of advanced cloud technologies like PubSub, diverse Cloud StorageModels, Cloud APIs, VPC, IAM, and other pertinent services is crucial for the effective executionof your duties. This role will be working closely with machine learning teams to bolster MLworkflows, harnessing your knowledge in GPU programming, CUDA, OpenMP, and parallelcomputing paradigms and product teams to establish precise requirements and Service LevelObjectives (SLOs) for the secure and seamless deployment of software.
Your skills and dedication will also encompass the maintenance of both cloud-based andphysical Linux servers powering the Datature platform, ensuring the highest levels of availabilityand reliability in production environments, even within air-gapped contexts.
Job ResponsibilitiesSupervise cloud environments spanning AWS, GCP, Azure, and EKS through the utilization of Python, Terraform, and IaC tools.Leverage your expertise in cloud technologies (PubSub, Cloud Storage Models, Cloud APIs, VPC, IAM, Kubernetes) to meet stringent government and military security and reliability standards.Collaborate with machine learning teams, providing support for ML workflows with GPU programming, CUDA, and parallel computing.Uphold the availability of cloud and physical Linux servers in air-gapped production environments, ensuring continuous operation and security.Seamlessly integrate Google Cloud services with our core cloud management systems, employing Terraform templates and creating or adapting scripts that integrate with both first-party and third-party operational and observability tools.Work closely with product teams to comprehend requirements and establish Service Level Objectives (SLOs) for the deployment of software in air-gapped environments.
Job RequirementsHold a bachelor's degree in Computer science, Engineering, or a related field, coupled with over 5 years of pertinent professional work experience.Demonstrate a proven track record of success in Google Cloud and Terraform, particularly in the deployment of cloud or on-premise applications.Possess a solid understanding of Kubernetes, Ansible, and Docker technologies, with production experience in crafting and administering Kubernetes-based systems.Exhibit familiarity with microservices, API design (both REST and gRPC), and the development of cloud-native applications.Display a strong background in managing and maintaining Linux servers in production environments.Have experience with Kubernetes cross-cluster federation, Kubernetes API, Operator, and Custom Resource Definition (CRD) Development.Prior exposure to containers (Docker) and orchestration (OpenShift/Kubernetes) within secure, air-gapped facilities is a valuable asset.Singaporeans and Singapore PRs are preferred candidates.
📧 Interested in applying? Please click on the ‘Easy Apply’ button. Alternatively, send your resume to sophia.ng@storm2.com for more info or to have a confidential conversation.

Job description:
Red Dot Analytics is looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for deploying, testing, maintaining, and integrating software systems. This role will work closely with the development team to ensure software quality, reliability, and performance.
Key Responsibilities
Develop and implement Devops strategies and best practices.Collaborate with developers and other teams to ensure continuous integration and delivery of software applications.Design and implement automation tools for deployment and monitoring of software applications.Maintain and improve the performance of existing infrastructure and applications.Troubleshoot issues and provide resolutions in a timely manner.Stay up-to-date with new technologies and tools in Devops and implement them as appropriate.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.3+ years of experience in Devops.Strong understanding of Linux operating systems and scripting languages.Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud and Azure.Proficient in automation tools such as Ansible, Puppet, and Chef.Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes.Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Who We Are
Verily is a subsidiary of Alphabet that is using a data-driven approach to change the way people manage their health and the way healthcare is delivered. Launched from Google X in 2015, our purpose is to bring the promise of precision health to everyone, every day. We are focused on generating and activating data from a variety of sources, including clinical, social, behavioral and the real world, to arrive at the best solutions for a person based on a comprehensive view of the evidence. Our unique expertise and capabilities in technology, data science and healthcare enable the entire healthcare ecosystem to drive better health outcomes.
Description
As a Staff Cloud Platform Engineer at Verily you will help us develop our cloud platform capabilities and tools that enable Verily engineering teams to deliver scalable, reliable, secure and performant production systems. You will work with software engineers, hardware engineers and data scientists to help them learn, adapt and adopt our core cloud management tools and best practices. You will also help develop documentation and training material and evangelize these technologies and capabilities to the broader engineering organization. As an expert in Cloud technologies, you will also help influence architecture and infrastructure decisions within the broader engineering organization.
Responsibilities
Work on Verily’s core production management and automation platforms to improve the operability and usability of Verily’s cloud systems. Develop and drive adoption of core cloud provisioning systems (eg. Terraform, Atlantis, Google Cloud tooling).Build and deliver training material for Verily engineering teams to help them measure and improve the reliability, observability, scalability, and automation level of their services. Integrate Google Cloud services with our core cloud management systems, utilizing Terraform templates and developing or modifying scripts that integrate with 1st party and 3rd party operational and observability tools. 
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications 
Practical experience and/or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical field.5+ years experience in Terraform development and testing.8+ years experience in programming in at least one of the following: Go, Python, Rust, BASH, Typescript and Java.Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with Google Cloud and Kubernetes.Exposure to Splunk and/or DataDog.Familiarity with designing, implementing, and managing complex distributed systems in a public cloud environment (GCP, AWS, or Azure).Experience writing technical documentation or building codelabs.
Why Join Us
Build What’s Vital.
At Verily, you are a part of something bigger. We are a diverse team of builders innovating at the intersection of health and technology—united by a shared spirit of curiosity, resilience and determination to make better health possible for all. This builder mindset means your fingerprints will be on the work that shapes the future of health.
Fulfilling our precision health purpose starts with the health of our Veeps, which is why we offer flexibility, resources, and competitive benefits to support you in your whole-person well being.
Our culture reflects the behaviors that stem from living our values every day in how we Innovate Healthcare and Technology, Gain Velocity as One Verily, and Respect Individuals. As One Verily, we uphold our collective accountability to sustain this culture and to create a VIBE (Verily’s Culture of Inclusion, Belonging, and Equitability) where all Veeps feel included, a sense of belonging, and have opportunities to grow.
If this sounds exciting to you, we would love to hear from you.
You can find out more about our company culture on our LinkedIn Company Page and Verily Careers page.

Job description:
Responsibility
 Design, develop, deploy, and manage scalable, secure, and reliable cloud-based infrastructure solutions and systems Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices Configure and maintain cloud services, including virtual machines, containers, serverless functions, networking, storage, and security Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and process functions in accordance with company security policies and best practices in cloud security Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues Regularly review existing systems and make recommendations for improvements Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and design cloud architectures that align with business needs Interact with clients, provide cloud support, and make recommendations based on client needs Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to cloud infrastructure, network connectivity, and application deployments
Requirement
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent Minimum 3 years of working expereince in a Cloud Engineer or similar role, with a focus on designing, deploying, and managing cloud-based solutions/operations Strong knowledge of cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g., Python, Java, Ruby) and experience with automation and configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Terraform). Solid understanding of cloud networking concepts, including virtual private clouds (VPCs), subnets, routing, and load balancing. Knowledge of security best practices and experience implementing security controls in cloud environments Knowledge of hybrid cloud architectures and experience with cloud migration strategies As many as Azure certification Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment

Responsibilities
Design and Implement Web3 Infrastructure: Collaborate with development teams to design and set up the infrastructure necessary for Web3 applications, including blockchain integration, decentralized storage, and smart contract deployment.
Automation and CI/CD: Develop and maintain automation scripts and CI/CD pipelines for Web3 projects. Streamline the deployment process and ensure continuous integration and continuous deployment practices are followed.
Blockchain Integration: Work on the integration of various blockchain technologies into the infrastructure, such as Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, or other blockchain platforms. Manage blockchain nodes and wallets.
Decentralized Storage: Implement and maintain decentralized storage solutions like IPFS or Filecoin for data storage and retrieval in Web3 applications.
Security and Compliance: Ensure the security and compliance of Web3 applications and infrastructure. Implement security best practices, conduct regular security audits, and stay updated on blockchain security vulnerabilities.
Scaling and Optimization: Manage high-load environments and implement auto-scaling solutions to handle increased user activity. Optimize resource allocation to reduce operational costs.
Containerization and Orchestration: Utilize Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration of Web3 services, ensuring scalability and flexibility.
Monitoring and Logging: Implement monitoring and alerting solutions for blockchain nodes, decentralized storage, and web3 services. Utilize ELK stack or similar tools for centralized log management.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Use tools like Terraform and Spinnaker to define and manage infrastructure as code, making it easier to provision and scale resources.
Collaboration and Knowledge Sharing: Collaborate with development, blockchain, and smart contract teams to understand requirements and ensure smooth integration. Share knowledge and best practices with team members.
Disaster Recovery: Implement robust backup and disaster recovery solutions to minimize data loss in case of blockchain network failures or other critical incidents.
Requirements
Experience: A minimum of 8 years of experience in software design, development, and DevOps, with a strong focus on web3 technologies and blockchain integration.
Technical Expertise: Strong technical skills in system and application tools and design, particularly related to web3 platforms. Experience with blockchain technologies and decentralized applications (dApps).
Education: A degree in Computer Science and Engineering or a related field is preferred.
Certifications: Certification in relevant technologies such as blockchain platforms (e.g., Ethereum), Kubernetes, or AWS/Azure/GCP can be advantageous.
Cloud Experience: Practical experience in building and operating platforms on cloud providers like AWS, including EC2, ECS, ELB, and VPC.
CI/CD: Proficiency in CI/CD tools like Jenkins for automating software delivery pipelines.
Scripting: Programming experience in scripting languages like Python for automation tasks.
Operating Systems: At least 8+ years of strong experience working on an admin level with both Linux and Windows systems.
Configuration Management: Familiarity with configuration management frameworks such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible.
Distributed Systems: Strong experience in managing cluster setups for technologies like RabbitMQ, Redis, and MongoDB.
Containerization and Orchestration: Proficiency in Docker and Kubernetes for containerization and orchestration.
Infrastructure as Code: Familiarity with IaC tools like Terraform and Spinnaker.
Monitoring and Logging: Experience with monitoring tools and log management, including ELK stack and other central log management solutions.
Blockchain Knowledge: A deep understanding of blockchain technology, smart contracts, and decentralized applications is a significant advantage.
Security: Knowledge of blockchain security best practices and experience in securing Web3 applications and infrastructure.

Job description:
About AxisNow
We started building AxisNow in 2023 to solve the challenges every company faces securing, delivering, and managing access to resources. While the way we use technology has changed dramatically over the past 30 years, the access control models and complex stacks of tools most companies rely on are frustrating for administrators and users alike. AxisNow aims to change that, accelerating the transition of the digital world to a modern secure access model, making it easy for companies of all sizes to implement SASE/SSE/ZTNA, whether you are an SMB or a Fortune 500. We believe that an effective cybersecurity solution needs to be easy to use, easy to maintain, and designed with the end user experience in mind.
About The Role
Axisnow is looking for a talented and experienced SRE engineer to join our startup in Singapore. This role is ideal for experienced and motivated SRE engineers with strong operational skills and a passion for building great services.
This position is eligible for stock options
What Will You Do
 Work with product R&D team to build production environment and provide solutions for our business. Responsible for the operation of the platform (such as: change, monitoring, response, capacity, elasticity, architecture evolution, etc.), responsible for service stability, availability, and scalability. Cooperate with the technical support team to respond to specific customer failures, troubleshoot, analyze, and solve difficult problems, and provide customers with stable and reliable services. Design, develop and implement DevOps processes, methodologies, and tools. Contribute to the design and implementation of new product developments in R&D.
The one we are looking for
 At least 3 years of DevOps/SRE working experience. Familiar with Linux, familiar with TCP/IP, HTTP protocol, DNS protocol, Proxy, CDN. Big advantage! - Familiar with IDC network (protocol, routing, tunnel, etc.). Bonus Points! - Familiar with at least 2 languages in Shell, Python and Go. Extra Credits! - Experience in DDoS/WAF security operations. Plus! - Extensive experience in developing solutions for complex large-scale production environments, preferably high-availability SaaS experience with microservices architecture. Strong skills or intuition in problem solving. Love technology with the attitude of understanding how it works. Self-motivated, proactive approach with end-to-end process, thrive under pressure. Details and results oriented. Proficient in Mandarin and English.

Job description:
You will research and identify potential security risks using Threat and Risk Assessment framework, and develop actionable measures to be applied across systems for the government agencies.
About The Role
Perform security risk assessments for large projects or systems.Explore technologies and best practices to support development of standards.Support business initiatives through risk management, which involves performing security risk assessment to identify and analyse security risks, recommending risk treatment and mitigation measures, and assess residual risks.Ensure that key security requirements are defined and designed into the systems, implemented in accordance to the security design, and in compliance with prevailing ICT security policies and standards.Develop and review project specific security specifications and ensure alignment to assessed security risks, security requirements, prevailing ICT security policies and standards.Review security architectures, designs and implementations to ensure compliance with prevailing ICT security policies and standards. Identify design gaps and recommend security enhancements.Involve in designing artefacts (spanning design, development, and implementation) into enterprise systems that are aligned to security principles and overall Enterprise System Architecture.Stay abreast of current and emerging security technologies for cloud and on-premises, as well as the associated security threats and risks. Design security architecture and control measures to mitigate the relevant threats and risks.Align security architecture frameworks and standards with business strategies and functions.Involve in scoping of security tests, reviews and audits, as well as reviewing the results of security tests, reviews and audits to ensure security assurance is achieved.Partner with the cybersecurity team, stakeholders, project teams, and outsourced vendors to ensure security objectives are achieved.Manage stakeholder relationships to ensure that consulting services delivered meet their expectations.
Requirements
Minimum 3 years of IT security experience in IT security consultancy, and security operations (which includes experience in management, deployment and maintenance of security for ICT systems).Knowledgeable in cloud security.Prior experience in security apps development is desirable.Knowledge and experience in ICT security risk management methodologies and risk evaluation techniques.Able to articulate cybersecurity risks, mitigation measures and residual risks orally and in writing to stakeholders, in an easily understood and actionable manner.Knowledge of security technologies (such as SIEM, Log Management and Analysis Tools, firewall, cryptography, vulnerability scanning tools, endpoint security, identity and access management), and frameworks (such as MITRE ATT&CK framework), and security domains (such as network security, cloud security and application security).Knowledge of system security architecture concepts including network topology, protocols, components and principles (e.g. application of Defence in Depth), and able to specify where and how security controls should be applied to or engineered into the security design.Degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering or Information Technology or related disciplines.Singapore Citizen only

Job Title: DevOps Technical Engineer (Obsolescence Remediation and Platform Support) JR 18856
Job description:
Find Your Dream Job With Us
WE ARE HIRING !! Apply now and make a difference.
Role: DevOps Technical Engineer (Obsolescence Remediation and Platform Support)
Job Requisition Number : JR18856
Job Level : More than 7 years of relevant experience (L3/L4)
Location : Singapore
Job Objectives
You will be responsible to uplift and remediate obsolescence issues on all DevOps servers and platform tools. Remediation process and technicalities require candidates to be technical person.
This role include responsibilities and tasks to ensure DevOps systems reliability, availability and getting systems back to steady state as quickly as possible.
You design and implement automation initiatives, perform script development and use DevOps tools to the advantage. In this portfolio of DevOps platform, you would also be responsible to maintain all DevOps Enterprise toolsets, OS patching, tools version upgrades, certificate-renewals. You would adopt enterprise monitoring culture, implementing SRE principles to identify and remediate issues before SLA, SLI, SLOs are violated. The successful candidate will be a technically savvy, dynamic leader, excellent communicator, have demonstrable technical hand-on supporting DevOps toolset coupled with excellent infrastructure knowledge and automation expertise.
As part of a cross-functional product development group, you should be comfortable with working as part of highly talented teams ensuring that modern technology and process are utilised as part of the role.
Key Responsibilities
We’re looking for a hands-on engineer who will be:
 MUST have deep hands-on knowledge and experience in Dynamic Application Security Testing (DAST) methodology and related tools like App Scan

Job Title: DevOps Technical Engineer (Obsolescence Remediation and Platform Support) JR 18856
Job description:
Find Your Dream Job With Us
WE ARE HIRING !! Apply now and make a difference.
Role: DevOps Technical Engineer (Obsolescence Remediation and Platform Support)
Job Requisition Number : JR18856
Job Level : More than 7 years of relevant experience (L3/L4)
Location : Singapore
Job Objectives
You will be responsible to uplift and remediate obsolescence issues on all DevOps servers and platform tools. Remediation process and technicalities require candidates to be technical person.
This role include responsibilities and tasks to ensure DevOps systems reliability, availability and getting systems back to steady state as quickly as possible.
You design and implement automation initiatives, perform script development and use DevOps tools to the advantage. In this portfolio of DevOps platform, you would also be responsible to maintain all DevOps Enterprise toolsets, OS patching, tools version upgrades, certificate-renewals. You would adopt enterprise monitoring culture, implementing SRE principles to identify and remediate issues before SLA, SLI, SLOs are violated. The successful candidate will be a technically savvy, dynamic leader, excellent communicator, have demonstrable technical hand-on supporting DevOps toolset coupled with excellent infrastructure knowledge and automation expertise.
As part of a cross-functional product development group, you should be comfortable with working as part of highly talented teams ensuring that modern technology and process are utilised as part of the role.

Knowledge of DevOps Tools

About M-DAQ
M-DAQ is a Singapore-headquartered financial technology company that empowers businesses and individuals in cross-border transactions by harnessing data to provide foreign exchange clarity and certainty. Our innovation of tomorrow further leverages data to provide embedded finance solutions to offer corporates and their employees more convenience and control.
Founded in 2010 with the belief that resources may be limited but aspirations are not, M-DAQ’s vision is to create a World without Currency Borders™ for all to participate and thrive in the global economy. We serve global e-commerce marketplaces, securities exchanges, financial technology companies, and corporates across 45 markets. M-DAQ Group processes S$14bn cross-border transactions annually and turned net profitable in 2018 for its core Aladdin+ business. We have offices across Singapore, Indonesia, China, Hong Kong, Japan, Korea, Sri Lanka and the United Kingdom, and we are backed by international institutions such as Affinity Equity Partners, Ant Group, EDBI, NTT Communications, and Samsung.
Key Responsibilities
 Deliver highly scalable and reliable business applications Work with devs to enhance core platforms Contribute expertise on information system security, risk and operational impact Manage API uptime and infrastructure monitoring environment. Collaborating with developers on software requirements, as well as interpreting test stage data Developing interface simulators and designing automated module deployments Overseeing routine maintenance procedures and performing diagnostic tests Documenting processes and monitoring performance metrics Confirming to best practices in network administration and cybersecurity
Desired Skill Set and Attributes
 BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience At least 3 years of relevant work experience with Python, Java, JavaScript, shell scripting Proven, Hands-On experience with RHEL or Centos Linux, other flavors of UNIX, windows. 3+ years experience with databases: Oracle / PostgreSQL. Willingness to learn new technologies and help others. Able to work effectively in a team.
Preferred Qualifications
 Experience implementing unit, integration and e2e tests Demonstrated the ability to look forward and anticipate problems and needs Demonstrated ability to lead or drive a project with sound technical and design skills. Must have direct hands-on experience with AWS services such as: EC2, AWS VPC, S3, Route53, CloudFormation, Cloudwatch Certifications in AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Hashicorp (e.g. Terraform) Experience with CI/CD tools Experience with monitoring rools (prometheus, grafana, elk..) Practical knowledge on SVN/GIT source code management Experience with one or more of the following Jenkins, Maven, Docker, Nagios, Shinken, KVM.
Why Us?
 Make a positive impact to the world’s economy by creating a World without Currency BordersTM Team Innovation Mindset, People-Oriented Challenging environment, offering great opportunities to learn and grow Creative and Innovative Workplace

About The Role
You will be working closely with our technology experts, and have the chance to be mentored by our CTO. Hybrid Cloud deployments are becoming the norm with organisations leveraging the flexibility of public cloud and yet needing to maintain legacy systems on premise. You will be working with our clients on AWS Cloud project implementations and managed services. While your Cloud and technology infrastructure expertise may be your forte, you are also expected to have an understanding of application development methodologies and frameworks (eg, AGILE, DevSecOps, etc) as you will be interfacing with applications teams for a large part. Most of the projects will be driven by the business needs, and largely driven from an application perspective with your Cloud and infrastructure expertise coming to support the applications. You will be working with a team of high-performance individuals and technologists, and will be a part of the digital transformation team.
Role and Responsibilities
The Candidate Is Expected To Perform The Following Duties
 Perform Cloud cost estimation using AWS Calculator. Analyse and optimize Cloud consumption using AWS tools or AWS Marketplace tools. Implement the Cloud architecture using infrastructure as code templates and tools (eg, Terraform) Configure the security groups and network security requirements. Work with application/solution teams to fine tune the Cloud architecture to ensure resilience and performance. Assist the lead architect in defining Cloud operational or governance standards, tools, and other related best practices. Assist the lead architect in architecture reviews with project stakeholders. Hands-on implementation, configuration, installation, performance tuning, and POCs.
Experience and Personality Ideals
 At least 1 year of experience on AWS Cloud. Basic understanding of infrastructure applications/development, quality assurance and integration methodologies, concepts and facilities in a cloud environment. Good understanding of security considerations on Cloud. Strong analysis, decision-making, and problem solving skills. Demonstrates logical abstract thinking and assimilating/adhering to project goals and deadlines. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, clients, vendors etc. Resourceful and able to manage your own work with minimal supervision. Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing. Able to work well under pressure and as part of a team. Good interpersonal skills. Pays attention to detail. Know how to have fun in challenging situations.
Qualifications And Education Requirements
 Diploma in Infocomm Technology would be advantageous. Certified AWS Associate level in any of the following preferred: SysOps Administrator Associate or Solutions Architect Associate Other technical certifications would be advantageous. Fluent in English, written and spoken required. Required to clear G50 security clearance. Singapore citizen or PR.
Contact information
Email CV to jobs@focus.sg

Industries: Software Development:Design Services:IT Services and IT Consulting
Job description:
Position Overview

Autodesk Identity Access and Management team is seeking a skilled and highly motivated individual who loves to find and develop efficient, scalable, and thoughtful solutions to various technical and product challenges. As a team member, you will have the opportunity to work with the team that builds Autodesk’s Identity Access Management Platform. The service is one of the key business enablers serving millions of Autodesk customers daily. It is leveraged by 150+ Autodesk desktop, mobile, web applications and cloud services and a growing third-party developer ecosystem for managing user authentication, and authorization.

Responsibilities
Work as a Software Engineer Intern, member of a self-organized agile team that builds, owns and runs the service as a platform to enable Enterprise Single-Sign-On feature for the enterprise customers of Autodesk. Develop, own, and maintain the cloud service. Assist in the operation of the service, e.g., monitoring, alerting, metrics, logging, and troubleshooting. Work closely with senior engineers, architects, product owners End-to-end service ownership such as debugging complex technical issues involving multiple system & components. 
Minimum Qualifications
You must be enrolled in a full-time Bachelor's Program in Computer Science or Engineering or other relevant fields You must either be in your penultimate or final year of studies, and will be graduating in 2024 or 2025 Good understanding in OOP, and its implementation within relevant programming language such as Go, Java, C++, C#, Python, or others Familiar with web services, including REST Internship period: Jan – June 2024 
Preferred Qualifications
Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills Committed to quality, including security and performance Solid analysis and critical thinking Good understanding in system or software testing best practices, automated build, and test cases Ability to convey complex message in an understandable form (written/spoken) Good foundation in system/software performance metrics, especially in web application Experience in cloud-native application development Good understanding of cloud infrastructure, especially in AWS 
Learning Benefits

In this role, you will have the opportunity to learn and work on a cloud service. You will have the opportunity to build and run a cloud service that is secure, stable, and testable guided by experienced software engineers. We are utilizing multiple state-of-the-art tools which will expose you to the modern way of building a proper distributed system.

About Autodesk

With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It is disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity.

Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers, and architects to digital artists, students, and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.

At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.

Autodesk has always valued flexibility in how we work. We continue to provide employees flexibility to support their work preferences wherever possible and nearly all roles are hybrid or remote, unless otherwise indicated.

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers.

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location.
