Job description:
Sonatype is the software supply chain management company. We're on a mission to change how the world innovates by making software development easier. From running the world's largest repository of Java open-source components (Maven Central) to inventing componentized software development and then software supply chain management to creating the only solution that stops malicious open-source malware in its tracks, we're constantly leading the industry while helping thousands of customers manage open source every day.
Already used by 15 million developers, we have lofty goals for our technology to be in the hands of every engineering team. And we need you to do that. Join us !
Learn more at www.sonatype.com .
If you want to have a greater impact in the open-source ecosystem by enabling our customers to build better software faster - then you should keep reading. We are adding more Customer Success Engineers (CSE) to ensure our customers continuously see value across the Sonatype Nexus Platform.
Why this role matters
Our users are software developers, security officers, and DevOps managers. We offer them subscriptions to valuable software that works. As long as our customers value their investment, they will continue to renew and expand their deployments.
Fortunately, our customers trust Sonatype and value their investments. This is proven by our 90%+ renewal rate -- one of the highest renewal rates in the software subscription business. We are also proud of receiving a coveted 2021 Gainsight GameChanger award for our outstanding customer service. But we choose not to rest on our laurels. If our customers are not optimised, adequately deployed, or have compromised rollouts due to their lack of time, technical know-how/resources, or understanding of best practices - it will inhibit our mutual ability to achieve success. That is why this role is so meaningful.
What Are CSEs Do
Mentor and educate customers on implementation and usage best practices for the Sonatype Nexus Platform to ensure smooth onboarding, faster adoption, and increased footprint.Discover and analyse gaps in the customer experience, identifying early warning signals and working with multi-functional teams to address them.Act as the voice of the customer - using your insights to help us drive improvements, influence product roadmap, and deploy customer advocacy programs.Ensure customers are SUCCESSFUL and DELIGHTED with Sonatype products and services, not merely satisfied.
What We Are Looking For
Our CSEs come from many different backgrounds, including DevOps Engineers, Software Engineers, Quality Engineers, and Solutions Architects. While the paths are different, they all share the following:Broad knowledge of current SDLC and the tooling that development organisations use to build applicationsWell-honed project management and interpersonal skillsDesire to build long-term relationships and help our customers be successful.Ability to travel. Although this position is a 100% remote role, we expect that travel to customer locations will be 15-20%.Must currently reside in Australia and be authorized to work without sponsorship. 
Things that we are proud of
2023 Fast Company Best Places for Innovators2023 Leader in Forrester-Wave for Software Compensation Analysis2023 Gartner's Magic Quadrant2023 Software Report's Top 100 Software Companies2023 BuiltIn Best Places to Work2022 Frost & Sullivan Technology Innovation Leader Award2022 PeerSpot Silver Peer Award in Software Composition Analysis2022 Tech Ascension Best DevOps Security Solution Award2022 NVCT Cyber Company of the YearCompany Wellness Week - We shut down company operations for a week to enable all employees to spend time pursuing personal growth and enjoying much needed and deserved rest. Diversity & Inclusion Working GroupsParental Leave PolicyPaid Volunteer Time Off (VTO)
At Sonatype, we value diversity and inclusivity. We offer perks such as parental leave, diversity and inclusion working groups, and flexible working practices to allow our employees to show up as their whole selves. We are an equal-opportunity employer, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know.
Skills: Customer Advocacy:Customer Experience:Customer Success:Early Warning:Interpersonal Skills:Multi-functional:Networking:Nexus:Product Road Mapping:Voice of the Customer

Job Title: Software Engineer - Digital Transformation (Cloud/Full Stack Experience)
Job description:
Date: 5 Sep 2023
Service Line / Portfolios:
Location:
Singapore, Singapore, SG
What impact will you make?
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Whatever your aspirations, Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.
So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.
Work you’ll do
About Deloitte Tax & Legal Digital Transformation
The Deloitte Tax & Legal Digital Transformation team is responsible for developing custom software solutions for our Tax & Legal professionals across SEA as well as integrating our systems into global Deloitte platforms. We build platforms using a User-centered design (UCD) approach by engaging directly with the business teams. Our team of about 15 team members are all passionate about Software Development and enjoy working with talented individuals in an Agile manner. We strive to build platforms that improve the capabilities of our Tax & Legal professionals enabling them to deliver quality services to our clients as efficiently as possible.
We believe that learning is bidirectional and hope to learn from you along the way. Our team regularly shares code, best practice updates, and general knowledge through Azure DevOps Wikis, Microsoft Teams, and Zoom calls. We also run a Dev Q&A session every Friday to peer program with more experienced developers and ask general programming questions. We provide various technical trainings to our team as well as host annual beginner, intermediate and expert Microsoft Excel sessions for all the Singapore Tax & Legal professionals.
We are still growing our TDD (Test Driven Development) skillset, if you are a strong TDD practitioner then we would love to hear from you. We heavily utilize Cloud and DevOps within our team and will continue to push into Docker and Kubernetes. We strive to be Agile and are continuing to grow in this area. Our teams regularly have scrums with the business to discuss their respective project backlog. We generally use the Microsoft stack; however, this is not required and if you have a great OOP background, then you will fit right in.
 Your Role 
You are a passionate software developer who enjoys working in an environment where you can continuously innovate as part of a diverse team and grow your software development skills through SOLID design principles.
You enjoy peer programming and sharing your knowledge with everyone on the team.
You treat programming similar to gardening and tend to your software with the utmost care adding Unit Test, Refactoring, improving your DevOps pipeline and feature deployment.
You prefer releasing features on a regular basis as opposed to releasing everything at once.
You are interested in and take Security seriously in your application development.
You see the numerous benefits of Cloud and take full advantage of Cloud services.
You understand the importance of discussing the benefits of Agile to those that have not experienced working in Agile teams before and take the time to review your development process after each sprint.
You have a “see it, own it, solve it” mentality and offer up solutions to problems rather than let these slide under the carpet or wait for someone else to fix it.
You enjoy coaching others to help them prosper in their careers and believe that coaching can happen regardless of what level you are in the organization.
You are comfortable saying no and offering up a lternatives if you think there are better solutions.
You understand that planning your sprint is important and commit to the sprint timelines you agree on together with your team.
You offer help to other team members if they are struggling with their sprint tasks and see the sprint target as a common goal owned by all members of the team.
You believe in creating technical documentation which are not limited to system design document, architectural documents, etc.
We welcome entry level candidates to apply and start their career with us.
Your role as a leader
At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We expect our people to embrace and live our purpose and shared values, challenging themselves everyday to identify issues that are most important to our clients, our people and the communities, and to make an impact that matters. In addition to living our purpose, Associates / Analysts / Consultants across our Firm are expected to:
 Understand the expectations set and demonstrates personal accountability for keeping own performance on track.  Understand how our daily work contributes to the priorities of the team and the business.  Demonstrate strong commitment to personal learning and development.  Actively focus on developing effective communication and relationship-building skills, with stakeholders, clients and team.  Work effectively in diverse teams within a highly inclusive team culture where everyone is supported, respected and recognized for their contribution. 
Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Requisition ID: 57062
In Singapore, the services are provided by Deloitte and other related entities in Singapore("Deloitte in Singapore"), which are affiliates of Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd. Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd is a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited. Deloitte in Singapore, which is within the Deloitte Network, is the entity that is providing this Website.
Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS):DevOps:Digital Transformation:Relationship Building:Software Development

Job description:
Experience: 10+ Years
Role: Senior DevOps Engineer
Key Skills: DevOps

Ready to accelerate your growth in one of the most fascinating and dynamic industries?

Our Tech Summer Internship program is the perfect opportunity for you to discover how tech and trading can join forces to make an impact on global financial markets.

Kickstart your learning in our global offices, alongside your peers. You'll have the exclusive opportunity to commence your training in Sydney, before returning to Singapore to put your knowledge into practice.

With guidance from your mentor and team, you'll lead entrepreneurial projects that solve Optiver’s real-world challenges. In just a few weeks, you’ll develop latency-critical applications that help improve global financial markets. Plus, if you’ve excelled over the summer, you could receive an offer to return as a Graduate Software Engineer.

With Optiver’s internship program, your work improving the market starts today. Apply now.

Who We Are

Optiver is a global tech-driven trading firm, with offices in Amsterdam, Sydney, London, Singapore, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Taipei, Chicago and Austin. Founded in 1986, today we are a leading liquidity provider, with close to 2,000 employees in offices around the world, united in our commitment to improve the market through competitive pricing, execution and risk management.

By providing liquidity on multiple exchanges across the world in various financial instruments we participate in the safeguarding of healthy and efficient markets. We provide liquidity to financial markets using our own capital, at our own risk, trading a wide range of products: listed derivatives, cash equities, ETFs, bonds and foreign currencies.

What You’ll Do

No previous experience in trading or financial markets? 

You bring the passion and we'll have the training to support you along the way.

As our Software Engineer Intern, you'll take ownership of critical projects right from the start. Whether it's developing ultra-low-latency exchange protocol encoders and decoders, or fine-tuning our automated trading strategies and pricing models, your goal is to find the simplest and cleanest solution to the problem at hand.

You’ll experience the excitement of a fast-paced development cycle – owning a tight feedback loop, testing and shipping your code to production. You could be working on a change to a trading system in the morning and see it running live in the afternoon. Our collaborative culture means you’ll work closely with Traders and other Engineers to identify and solve problems that make a tangible impact on the business.

By the end of the internship, you’ll have learnt the ins-and-outs of our trading systems and the engineering concepts that make them successful.

Aside from technical skills, our Head of IT Education will also work with you on your development, including:

Workshops on a variety of tech-based topics, along with soft skills to support your holistic growth as an engineer.A dedicated mentor who will guide you through our development process and how our trading systems workTrader training to get you up to speed on our business. This helps you understand the fundamentals of trading, enabling you to make an impact from the early stages of your Optiver career.

Discover the exciting projects you could work on during your internship.

Read Brenda’s story on delivering low-latency, high-throughput systems that improve our connectivity to the financial market.Read Richard’s story on navigating the world of automated trading – systems that make trading decisions.Read Marcus’s story on working in the risk and treasury team, where he monitors systems that manage and mitigate risk (e.g., trading risk).Read Lena’s story on production engineering, where they build tools and systems that enable us to trade smoothly.

Who You Are

You’re a problem solver at heart. You won’t stop until you’ve found a solution and then you'll take one step further to improve it. In addition, you’re:

Keen to create high-performing, low latency designs that critically impact trading successCurious to learn and comfortable discussing/exploring complex technical ideasYou have a range of out-of-classroom projects or extra-curricular activities that demonstrates your passion in technology, particularly software developmentKeen to work alongside the best engineers and traders in the industry, with the humility to continually upskill and improve yourselfKnowledgeable about object orientated design and development concepts (experience with C++, C# or Java is required for our technical assessment)

What You’ll Get

The chance to work alongside diverse and intelligent peers in a rewarding environmentWe offer competitive remuneration, including an attractive bonus structure and additional leave entitlementsCorporate health insuranceTraining, mentorship and personal development opportunitiesWeekly in-house chair massagesDaily breakfast and lunchRegular social events

As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued and respected, because we believe our best work is done together.

Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from any and all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.

Eligibility

Optiver encourages Singaporean nationals to applyA penultimate or pre-penultimate university student

Job description:
Who Are We?
At HoYoverse, we are committed to creating immersive virtual world experiences for players around the world. In addition to game products such as Genshin Impact, Honkai Impact 3rd, Tears of Themis, and Honkai: Star Rail, HoYoverse also launched the dynamic desktop software N0va Desktop, the community product HoYoLAB, and created a variety of products such as animations, comics, music, novels, and merchandise around our original creative concept.
Adhering to our mission of Tech Otakus Save the World, we have always been committed to technology research and development, exploring cutting-edge technologies, and have accumulated leading technical capabilities in cartoon rendering, artificial intelligence, cloud gaming technology, and other fields.
HoYoverse is actively engaged in globalization, with offices in Singapore, Montreal, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Seoul, and other areas.
When you apply to a position with HoYoverse, we will process your personal data. To learn more about how we process your data, we encourage you to review our comprehensive Global Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy. This policy provides detailed insights into how your information is collected, used, and protected throughout the application process.

Bachelor's degree (or above) in Computer Science or related programs;Experience coding in an industry-standard language (e.g. Java, Kotlin, C/C++, JavaScript);Good understanding of CS fundamentals, such as algorithms, data structures, network, operating system, etc;Experience in Android tech stacks is preferred;Strong sense of ownership, fast learning ability and a good team player.
We are an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds are key to bringing our concepts to life. If you're looking to play a key role in creating the best immersive virtual world experience for our users, we invite you to join our team.

At HoYoverse, we are committed to creating immersive virtual world experiences for players around the world. In addition to game products such as Genshin Impact, Honkai Impact 3rd, Tears of Themis, and Honkai: Star Rail, HoYoverse also launched the dynamic desktop software N0va Desktop, the community product HoYoLAB, and created a variety of products such as animations, comics, music, novels, and merchandise around our original creative concept.
Adhering to our mission of Tech Otakus Save the World, we have always been committed to technology research and development, exploring cutting-edge technologies, and have accumulated leading technical capabilities in cartoon rendering, artificial intelligence, cloud gaming technology, and other fields.
HoYoverse is actively engaged in globalization, with offices in Singapore, Montreal, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Seoul, and other areas.
When you apply to a position with HoYoverse, we will process your personal data. To learn more about how we process your data, we encourage you to review our comprehensive Global Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy. We are an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds are key to bringing our concepts to life. If you're looking to play a key role in creating the best immersive virtual world experience for our users, we invite you to join our team.

Job description:
Job Description
You will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining AWS cloud infrastructure. You will work closely with our development and operations teams to ensure the scalability, security, and reliability of our cloud-based applications and services.
Key Responsibilities
Cloud Infrastructure Design:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and architect AWS cloud solutions that meet business and technical requirements. Develop infrastructure as code (IAC) templates using tools like AWS CloudFormation or Terraform. Deployment and Automation:Deploy and configure AWS services such as EC2, RDS, S3, Lambda, and more. Implement automation and orchestration processes for provisioning and managing AWS resources. Security and Compliance:Implement security best practices and configure AWS security services to protect cloud resources. Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations. Monitoring and Optimization:Set up monitoring, alerting, and logging solutions for AWS resources. Continuously monitor and optimize AWS infrastructure for cost-efficiency and performance. Troubleshooting and Support:Diagnose and resolve issues related to AWS services and cloud infrastructure. Provide technical support and guidance to internal teams. Documentation:Maintain clear and up-to-date documentation of cloud architecture, configurations, and processes.

Job description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
Are you a software engineer that thrives on complex challenges and is eager to make a real impact? Join our team where you'll be contributing to our strategic product line, that’s looking to reshape industries and change the way people work and learn.
Our strategic product line includes:
Crossover: An AI-powered hiring platform that sifts through millions of applicants per year to find the top 1% of global remote talent. We're breaking down geographical barriers and making high-paying jobs accessible to professionals worldwide, regardless of their location.gt.school: An online education platform that uses advanced data collection, algorithms, and AI-generated content to empower students to learn at their own pace. Our adaptive learning system fills knowledge gaps, accelerates learning, and helps students master a whole grade level on a subject within weeks.Data-driven Sales: This initiative leverages data and AI algorithms to streamline the sales process across a portfolio of over 100 software products. We're transitioning these products to a unified platform based on Salesforce and NetSuite, all while handling complex data imports, synchronization, modeling divergences and data inconsistencies.
What we offer:
The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies, including the latest in AWS serverless and no-code/low-code patterns.The opportunity to learn and experiment with using generative AI to boost your productivity.A team of exceptionally talented engineers from around the world as your peers.The chance to work on products that are reshaping industries and making a difference in people's lives.
We're not just using AI as a buzzword. We're at the start of a thrilling journey with generative AI, experimenting and learning to fully leverage its potential and free our engineers from mundane tasks, allowing them to focus on what truly matters: design, decision-making, and understanding the far-reaching implications of different implementation strategies.
Showcase your skills, not just your resume. Take on our challenges: 15-min Cognitive, 90-min Coding, 120-min Technical Decision-Making. Excel and you'll face a decisive interview with our Hiring Manager. More than half walk away with an offer. Ready to unleash your potential? Apply today!
What You Will Be Doing
Developing cloud-native backends and implementing data processing algorithms using the latest serverless cloud patterns, including AWS.Review code to ensure adherence to best practices, team standards, and customer requirements.
What You Won’t Be Doing
Spending time on minor bug fixes or features in outdated codebases.Dealing with tedious infrastructure to keep poorly written products running.Getting stuck in endless meetings discussing roadmaps and priorities or chasing people around.
Basic Requirements
Back End Developer key responsibilities
At least 4 years of experience writing production code for the server side of web applications.At least 2 years of experience being the primary technical contributor for a development team OR software product.At least 1 year of hands-on experience developing using cloud patterns (any cloud vendor).An openness to learn to use generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
Nice-to-have Requirements
Experience in using generative A.I. in your day-to-day development work.
About Trilogy
Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
Working with Crossover
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
What to expect next:
You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.
Important! If you do not receive an email from us:
First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply. Crossover Job Code: LJ-4358-SG-Singapor-BackEndDevelop.088

Job description:
We are looking for an experienced Cloud Engineer to architect, expand and manage our cloud infrastructure on Microsoft Azure. The Cloud Engineer should bring substantial experience of best practice for cloud optimisation, in particular security. Working with in and out of house development teams the Cloud Engineer will be responsible for being the cloud SME for all initiatives as well as ensuring SLAs are continually met.
Key Responsibilities
Using the latest principles and technologies design, plan, support, and maintain Cloud Infrastructure build and operations to meet and exceed requirements.Apply technical knowledge and customer insights to build and maintain a cloud infrastructure that is a true enabler for company to grow.Help architect solutions to meet business needs, ensuring the security and technical viability of new projects and successful deployments.Work with our Security Team to ensure the cloud is secured by design, continuously monitored, and audited to ensure compliance.Serve as a Subject Matter Expert in key projects, bringing cutting edge technical knowledge to help ensure success and fulfilment potential.
Key Requirements
More than 5 years’ hands on experience as a cloud engineer, at least 2 of which using Microsoft Azure.Experience in a SaaS type environment, with service consumption by external users.Proven experience in architecting, developing and maintaining complex, performant and secure cloud infrastructure.Deep understanding of cloud-based Networking, Security, Storage, Management, DR, BCP and using these in combination to solve complex challenges.Desirable to have an understanding of SDLC and agile methodology, having led or participated in sprint based work.Ideally experience supporting developers in a cloud environment, utilising the latest cloud technologies for both application development as well as execution.A broad set of technology skills in micro service design patterns and technology architecture concepts.A problem solving mindset, willing to drive projects and issue resolution to conclusion.

Who We're Looking For

We are looking for an experienced JavaScript developer with expertise in both front-end and familiar with back-end (nodejs) technologies to work with our APAC Schroders Investment and Digital development team. You'll work with like-minded technologists globally with a variety of skill sets, focused on building best-of-breed interactive investor and client facing digital experiences using modern, appropriate technologies. We're after an adaptable engineer to work within a team that delivers software that's fast, reliable, and has a tangible impact on our business.

The team 

APAC Investment and Digital Technology focuses on delivery of outcomes that require close collaboration and deep expertise in core investment capabilities and best-of-breed digital experiences. We’re currently working on identifying and delivering client-facing interactive investment experiences.

We aim to maintain a great engineering culture. Contributing to this culture will involve following good software craftmanship, TDD and writing clean code. Our systems must be well architected, designed for testability and extensibility. To achieve this we implement mentoring and coaching through regular code reviews and pair programming.

You'll work with a team of enthusiastic individuals who are passionate about software in a financial context and evolving our investment and digital platforms. They're also keen on driving positive technology change at Schroders, ensuring that we always stay ahead of the curve.

About Schroders

We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.

We have around 5,500 people on six continents, and we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper.

What You'll Do
Develop web applications using front-end technologies including Next.js, React.JS, HTML5, CSS3 and Responsive DesignDevelopment of backend services and APIs using Node.js.Lead all aspects of software delivery in terms of design, development, testing and implementation.Refine the existing platform and products in response to business needsWork with business users to co-create maintainable Javascript code.Coach and develop more junior team members, ensuring that best practices and methodologies are followed The role requires a structured, creative individual who can support our growing demand for Digital development on a global level. It is a senior development position and strong technical skills are required. 
The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications You Need
Minimum 3 years of software development experience using front-end technologies, including React.JS, HTML5, CSS3 and Responsive Design, along with JavaScript frameworks and libraries.Experience developing backend-for-frontend APIs using Node.js.Experience in building customer facing interactive web experiences; collaborating with design, product, and other partners.Excellent software design principles and patterns, designing code for readability and reusability, scalability, and maintainability.Experience working in a modern software engineering environment following Agile principles, DevSecOps methodologies, test automation, CI/CD workflows, and tools including Git and Github.Have good communication skills and teamwork spirit, strong sense of responsibility, positive and optimistic attitude;
The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications That Will Help
An understanding of the investment management industryConfidence using cloud technologies (e.g. Azure, AWS).Experience building software solutions in the Financial Services domain
What You'll Be Like
A passionate technologist who follows the latest trends, technology, and engineering approachesA problem solver with a business-facing personalityAbility to own a piece of work from start to finishFocussed on understanding the underlying business requirements before producing concrete deliverablesAble to work under pressure.Great at working with other people, sharing, communicating and encouraging new ideas
We Recognise Potential, Whoever You Are

Our purpose is to provide excellent investment performance to clients through active management. Diversity of thought facilitated by an inclusive culture will allow us to make better decisions and better achieve our purpose. This is why inclusion and diversity are a strategic priority for us and why we are an equal opportunities employer: you are welcome here regardless of your age, disability, gender identity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, socio-economic background or any other protected characteristics
Salary expectations of candidates will be considered when assessing suitable candidates. Due to the high volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Provides operational support to customers for implementations and management of DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME solutions. Works closely with the customer on DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME Best Practices; ensures DELLEMC/STORAGE/IBM MAINFRAME solutions work as intended in the customer's environment.

The Position
In this exciting technical expert position within our global IT organization you have the opportunity to impact the development of Digital Products at Boehringer Ingelheim through providing a modern and state-of-the-art Kubernetes container platform infrastructure.
Our global IT drives innovative projects and we are constantly looking to transforming the way we work, in an agile and family-oriented environment in which we value diversity & inclusion, the passion of the people we work with and foster creativity and an open mindset.
You will work in a global, diverse product team with like-minded colleagues and will be able to collaborate cross-functionally with colleagues from different departments, within IT and Business.
Tasks & Responsibilities

Administrating, maintaining and ensuring compliance of Boehringer Ingelheim’s global Openshift PaaS Infrastructure, on premise and in the cloud.Managing Openshift container platform clusters across multi-cluster Kubernetes environments applying GitOps methodologies. Developing, improving and reviewing Openshift cluster configurationsAdvancing the architectural strategy and technical roadmap of the container platform technologiesIdentifying, installing, and assessing the value of tools of the Kubernetes ecosystem.Partnering with Engineers, Administrators, Architects, Developers and Project Managers to enable development and deployment of Business applicationMentoring and coaching the Developer and Engineer CommunityCreating and maintaining System Life Cycle documentation

Strong communication, customer-oriented skills and strong motivation to work in an agile operating model.Eagerness to grow by demonstrating an always learning cultureStrong command of the English language (both verbal and written)

Job description:
The Defence Science and Technology Agency (DSTA) brings you to the forefront of cybersecurity, digital transformation and engineering. From working on software development and systems integration to unmanned technologies and artificial intelligence, you can have an impact on Singapore’s defence.
Achieve your fullest potential with opportunities to build your technical expertise and hone your competencies in diverse domains. You can also expect an immersive learning experience, where you will work with bright minds and collaborate with global industry experts.
DSTA is recognised as one of the top 10 employers in the Engineering & IT sector, where our engineers and IT professionals work alongside procurement specialists to deliver state-of-the-art capabilities for Singapore’s peace and security.
Learn more about DSTA at https://www.dsta.gov.sg .
Opportunity
DSTA’s Information Programme Centre (Info PC) develops solutions to defend against information threats propagating on online platforms, such as disinformation, deep fakes and terrorist propaganda. We are looking for motivated individuals to design, implement and operate the system infrastructures and platform services to support the solutions.
The Role Will Require To
Architect, implement, operate and enhance the shared infrastructure (including cloud) and platform services that delivers compute, storage, network, security, monitoring, compliance management, backup and/or marketplace.Identify and lead initiatives to continuously build and enhance the management and performance of the shared infrastructure and platform.Interact with a dynamic group of developers, tenants and operators to design and build technical solutions to provide automation and self-serviceable capabilities in the areas for infrastructure deployment and operations.Actively engage with various stakeholders in problems management on shared infrastructure issues, to gather and analyze data to root out errors, discern trends, and diagnose complex system issues.
Requirements
Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Technology or related disciplineProficiency in basic Network infrastructureProficiency in one or more of the related Hyper-Converged Infrastructure, Cloud Network/Security/Platform Services will be preferred (e.g. Nutanix, VMWare, HyperV, OpenStack, SAN, Object and File Storage, IAM, Configuration and Compliance Management etc.)Familiarity with virtualization and container technologies like Nutanix, VMWare, OpenStack, Docker and Kubernetes will be advantageousFamiliarity with coding and scripting (e.g. VBS, Java, Python, Bash, PowerShell, Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, etc.) will be advantageousExperience with Public Cloud Services (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP, etc) will be advantageousStrong analytical skills, resourceful, meticulous, a team player and good communicatorCandidates with deep technical competency and experience in shared (including cloud) Infrastructure or Platform implementation and operation would be considered for Senior position.
Skills: Analytical Skills:Communication:Infrastructure Consolidation:Network Infrastructure:Systems Engineering

Job description:
Our client is at the forefront of cloud innovation, dedicated to delivering transformative cloud services that drive business agility, innovation, and efficiency. They are actively seeking a seasoned Lead Fullstack Developer to spearhead their development initiatives and champion best practices in both front-end and back-end development.
Responsibilities:
Lead the design, development, and deployment of full-stack applications using the latest cloud technologies and frameworks. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement new features and enhancements. Mentor and guide a team of developers, promoting a culture of technical excellence and continuous improvement. Ensure code quality, best practices, and maintainability through code reviews, testing, and refactoring. Engage with stakeholders to gather requirements and ensure that the software solutions align with business goals and the latest cloud innovations. Stay abreast of the latest trends in full-stack development and introduce innovative solutions that can benefit the projects. Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, ensuring optimal performance and scalability of applications. 
Requirements
Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of experience in full-stack development, with a focus on cloud-based solutions. Proficiency in both front-end and back-end technologies, including but not limited to JavaScript, Node.js, React, and cloud databases. Demonstrated experience in leading development teams and projects. Strong understanding of cloud architecture patterns, services, and best practices. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to adapt to changing project requirements. Strong communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with cloud platforms and services. Knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD, containerization, and orchestration. Familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools, such as Scrum or Jira.

Job Title: Systems Engineer, Office of Integrated Information Technology Services
Job description:
Company Description
Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.
Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.
Responsibilities Infrastructure ManagementPlan, development, deployment, and maintenance of Cloud hosted services to achieve high reliability and scalability for SMU IT services.Responsible for developing and implementing of IT security policies and IT security related procedures to protect SMU Cloud infrastructure.Regular review of SMU Cloud security posture and ensure that security remediation is executed in a timely manner.Identify and evaluate operations and support of the on-premises enterprise private cloud computing service as well as all related core infrastructure hardware. Manage and support Cloud orchestration services to meet SMU's computing needs for enterprise IT services.Plan, implement and maintenance of enterprise and research infrastructure (HPC) in SMU that include private and public cloud computing as well as all relevant research hardware to meet SMU's research computing needs for the various research areas.Plan, formulate and architect the growth of research infrastructure (HPC) to cater to the needs of SMU researchers so as to provide a boost for faculty productivity in research.Create and enforce acceptable usage standards, policies, and processes for both enterprise private and public computing services as well as other enterprise services such as Virtualization Desktop Infrastructure (VDI), storage and backup.Responsible for the maintenance of a healthy Configuration Management Database (CMDB).Proficient in Data Center Management and responsible for the efficient & reliable operations of Data Centers.Develop, maintain, and execute system operation procedures (e.g., IT Disaster Recovery) to achieve improved service availability, reliability, and redundancy.Consultancy and SupportProvide guidance on cloud-based solutions including tools, technologies, and best practices as well as consultancy across the IT divisions and businesses on the adoption of cloud.Provide first level consultation advice to users in the areas of mapping user's business and functional requirements to enterprise cloud computing service. Induct and assist cloud users on using, optimizing, and troubleshooting their applications in the cloud.Provide consultation advice to Faculty and post-graduates in the general areas of mathematical computing and computational use on the High-Performance Computing Cluster (HPCC). Communicate technology limitations/features and sets expectations.Provide support and consultancy to users in core enterprise services such as infrastructure systems and network.Conduct induction courses to raise awareness of the cloud computing and research platforms to the SMU community. Prepare presentations, documentation, and user's guide for users of cloud computing services and HPCC.OperationsManage IT project for existing system enhancement and new system implementation. Identify and evaluate operations & support of the on-premises enterprise private cloud computing service as well as all related core infrastructure hardware. Manage and support cloud orchestration services to meet SMU's computing needs for enterprise IT services.Establish project plans, milestones, and deliverables in consultation with immediate supervisor.Provide leadership to project team to ensure that proposals, plans and projects (technical) are evaluated and successfully executed.Monitor user requirements to keep up to date with latest technology developments in order to plan and improve the quality of use of cloud and research computing resources to encourage and increase utilization.Analyze enterprise and research infrastructure implementations and make changes as required, particularly with the increase usage and higher capacity demand from users.
Qualifications
Diploma / Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electronics/Electrical Engineering or related disciplines from a recognized universityCandidates with relevant certification in Cloud Computing (e.g., AWS, Azure), Terraform, and Linux will be highly advantaged.At least 3 to 5 years relevant working experience in IT and infrastructure systems support; ideally in a research center/academic setting.Strong knowledge in cloud computing orchestration and implementation. Competencies in cloud orchestration services mentioned below are highly desired.Composing of architecture, service catalog, tools, and processes to deliver the cloud computing service.Integrating software and hardware components together to deliver the cloud computing service.Connecting and automating workflows when applicable to deliver the cloud computing service.Experience and expertise working with Microsoft Azure and AWS experience would be desirable.Relevant working experience in Windows, Linux, and Unix systems administration. Linux/ Unix certifications will be an added advantage.Competencies in High Performance Computing (HPC) with skills in some of these programming languages such as C, C++, R, Python and Linux shell scripting are highly desired.Good technical, analytical, and troubleshooting skills and confident in providing frontline consultation and expertise applied across many academic disciplines / areas.Excellent command of written and oral communication skills. Attention to details and sound decision-making abilities.Good interpersonal and customer servicing skills. Enthusiastic and motivated team player.Independent, with initiative, positive attitude, and keen interest in exploring the areas of emerging cloud technologies.
Other Information
Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary.

Job description:
Singapore Resource Guide (Singapore) & Better Business Asia (Malaysia) provide Human Resources, Recruitment, Training, and Education consultancy dedicated to providing organizations in Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, and China with comprehensive HR solutions.
Our consultancy offers a variety of services to help businesses maximize their human resources, from recruitment and training to leadership development and career coaching.
Our team of experienced HR professionals is committed to helping our clients achieve their goals by providing tailored, effective solutions.
The Role
Your Responsibilities Will Include
Manage the IT infrastructure including Azure Cloud, hardware, and softwareapplication and provide support to end-usersTo install updates and patches for all IT systems includingplanning for scheduled preventive maintenanceTo manage in-house POS system and related hardwareTo explore new, faster business processes and implement analytics forThe meaningful decision for managementEnsure that all automated system processes (data backup etc.) andscheduled tasks (batch jobs) are properly carried out on timeTo update and maintain asset list for all hardware and softwarePrepare and maintain up-to-date documentation including SOP, user guide,network layout, system design, and configurationDeployed to client’s office island-wide Perform other duties assigned by management
Ideal Profile
Proficiency in managing IT infrastructure: The System Engineer should have the technical expertise to manage the company’s IT infrastructure, including Azure Cloud, hardware and software applications Ability to provide end-user support: The System Engineer should be able to provide support to end-users in a timely and effective manner. Knowledge of installation and maintenance: The System Engineer should be capable of installing updates and patches for all IT systems and planning for scheduled preventive maintenance. Familiarity with POS systems: The System Engineer should have experience managing in-house POS systems and related hardware. Understanding of analytics and business processes: The System Engineer should know exploring new, fast business processes and implanting analytics for meaningful decision-making for management Knowledge of automated system processes: The System Engineer should be familiar with automated system processes such as data backup and scheduled tasks (batch jobs) and ensure they are properly carried out on timeAbility to maintain asset lists: The System Engineer should update and maintain an up-to-date asset list for all hardware and software. Proficiency in the documentation: The System Engineer should prepare and maintain up-to-date documentation, including SOP, user guide, network layout, system design, and configuration. Flexibility and adaptability: The System Engineer should be able to perform other duties assigned by management and be flexible and adaptable to changing requirements. 
What's on Offer?
Attractive salary packageJoin a team of world class IT professionalsOpportunity for growth and development

Job description:
Company Description
Carousell Group is the leading recommerce group in Greater Southeast Asia on a mission to inspire the world to start selling, and to make secondhand the first choice. Founded in August 2012 in Singapore, the Group has a leading presence in eight markets under the brands Carousell, Cho Tot, Laku6, Mudah.my, OneKyat, Ox Street, and Refash, serving tens of millions of monthly active users. Carousell is backed by leading investors including Telenor Group, Rakuten Ventures, Naver, STIC Investments and Sequoia Capital India.
As a team of passionate individuals working together to solve meaningful problems, there is so much more for you to discover in a career with Carousell. Our culture is made up of hiring, developing, and promoting people who embody our values of solving problems for our users; having a mission-first mindset; being relentlessly resourceful; caring deeply; and staying humble to constantly improve. Together as an organisation, we make magic happen.
Job Description
Note - This will be a 6 months internship programme based in Singapore, the right to work in Singapore is required. Intern are start from January / February 2024.
Work closely with other engineers, product managers, designers and data scientists to build features and run experiments.Write clean, testable code.Work with the infrastructure team to deploy, scale and optimize the performance of your solutions.Participate in code reviews to maintain and contribute to a high-quality code culture.Learn to design and implement scalable solutions starting from broadly defined problems and first principles.Brainstorm with your team to understand the requirements and participate in the design discussion.Try different engineering domains you are interested in (Backend, Web, iOS, Android or Testing)

User obsession and empathy.Drive and resourcefulness to persevere and overcome obstacles achieving challenging goals.Focus on impact and results. You work on the right things and get them done.High integrity and ability to positively collaborate with others.Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions.Logical thinkingDegree in Computer Science, Software engineering or other equivalent degrees/experience.

By proceeding with your application, you are adhering to our PDPA policies. In case you are interested to know more, read about our Candidates Personal Data Privacy Statement.

Job description:
The L2 System Engineer Is Responsible For
 Assisting the Support Engineer or Software Engineer in problem resolution beyond the capability of the 1st Level Support Staff. Performing system recovery if needed. Escalating unsolvable problems to the 3rd Level Support Staff and reports the escalation to superior. Ensuring that the System runs according to contractual specifications after problem resolution. Providing advice on system / database performance monitoring and tuning. Ensuring deployments of approved patches/releases are implemented accordingly to Change Request. Complete all Service Requested accordingly to SLA timeframe. Assisting the Customer in the verification, isolation and/or provision of a temporary work-around for the problem logged beyond 2nd Level Support Staff capability. Escalating unsolvable system problems and service request to the OEM/Vendor for technical support. Coordinating system development tasks to include design, integration and formal testing on the Change Request. Overseeing all transitions into production on the Change Request. Developing and complete actions in system specifications, technical and logistical requirements and other disciplines on the Change Request. Creating and maintain programmatic and technical documentation to insure efficient planning and execution on the Change Request. Managing and document system configurations on the Change Request. Perform troubleshooting and resolve incident based on SLA. Generating the relevant administrative records and reports.
Standby after office hour.
Job Requirements

Job description:
Job Title: System Engineer
Location: 970 Toa Payoh North, #03-06/07/08, Singapore 318992
Job Type: Full-time
About Willowmore
We are a centrally located start-up technology company, specialising in Smart Access Control for critical infrastructure and we are currently experiencing strong growth. As the company scales, we are looking to bring on a System Engineer who can help support us through our next phase of growth and our development roadmap.
Job Summary
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced System Engineer with a strong background in cloud and Linux systems. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining cloud-based environments, as well as ensuring the availability, performance, and security of Linux-based server infrastructure. The individual must also possess strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic environment.
Responsibilities
Design, implement, and maintain on premise & cloud-based environmentsEnsure the availability, performance, and security of Linux-based server infrastructureInstall, configure, and maintain Linux servers (RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu)Implement and manage virtualization technologies (e.g., VMware, KVM)Collaborate with software development teams to ensure timely delivery of applications and servicesMonitor and analyse system performance and provide recommendations for improvementTroubleshoot and resolve system-related issuesProvide technical documentation and training for end-users and stakeholders
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fieldProven experience in cloud infrastructure setup and maintenance (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)Strong knowledge of Linux systems (RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu)Experience with virtualization technologies (VMware, KVM)Proficient in at least one scripting languageSolid understanding of networking principles and protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP)Experience with configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Chef)Excellent problem-solving and analytical skillsStrong communication and collaboration skillsAbility to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneouslyCertification in cloud technologies is a plusExperience with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
At Willowmore, we encourage and foster innovation and a continuous improvement culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for career growth and development. If you are a highly motivated and results-oriented individual with a passion for technological excellence, we invite you to join as System Engineer at Willowmore Pte. Ltd.
Please submit your resume detailing your relevant experience and qualifications, to yuki.lim@willowmore.com.sg.
We thank all applicants for their interest, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Your tasks 

To be the technical expert of the solution and provide the necessary support to customersResponsible for testing, verification, integration and commissioning of system projectsPerform acceptance tests in factory and on-siteDevelop system design and reviews documentation according to customer requirementsConduct training and after-sales support to customersPerform product demonstration to customer
Your Qualifications

Degree/Diploma in Electrical & Electronic, Telecommunications or Computer EngineeringKnowledge in RF, Spectrum Monitoring, CUAS, and/or networking experience will be given priorityFluent in English (knowledge of other languages is an advantage)Must be comfortable and able to handle defense and security solutionsStrong problem-solving skills as well as independent, self-motivated and result-orientedDedicated team player with strong job commitmentTravel (international) is requiredPersonnel with relevant or fitting positions will be considered for senior positions
 Interested?

Who Are We?
At HoYoverse, we are committed to creating immersive virtual world experiences for players around the world. In addition to game products such as Genshin Impact, Honkai Impact 3rd, Tears of Themis, and Honkai: Star Rail, HoYoverse also launched the dynamic desktop software N0va Desktop, the community product HoYoLAB, and created a variety of products such as animations, comics, music, novels, and merchandise around our original creative concept.
Adhering to our mission of Tech Otakus Save the World, we have always been committed to technology research and development, exploring cutting-edge technologies, and have accumulated leading technical capabilities in cartoon rendering, artificial intelligence, cloud gaming technology, and other fields.
HoYoverse is actively engaged in globalization, with offices in Singapore, Montreal, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Seoul, and other areas.
When you apply to a position with HoYoverse, we will process your personal data. To learn more about how we process your data, we encourage you to review our comprehensive Global Applicant and Candidate Privacy Policy. Job Title: Executive Engineer/ Senior Engineer (Systems Engineering and Development)
Job description:
[What the role is]
The global Unmanned Systems sector has made quantum leaps and is expected to continue growing rapidly. This growth is encouraged by the interest in developing technology and innovative use-cases for both commercial and recreational use, arising from the benefits that Unmanned Systems bring across multiple industries.
To capture the potential and opportunities of the Unmanned Systems sector for Singapore, the Unmanned Systems Technology, Engineering and Planning (UTEP) Division assesses, identifies, and forges partnerships with Industry, other Civil Aviation authorities and research entities to grow new business areas, initiate greenfield research and develop capabilities in Unmanned Systems for Singapore. The division also focuses on systems engineering, technology capabilities and strategic planning for the Unmanned Systems Group, in addition to integration, implementation and operational oversight of the maintenance of Counter-UAS Systems and sustainability initiatives under the airport pillar.
[What you will be working on]
As an officer in the Systems Engineering and Development section of UTEP Division, you will implement and manage software and command and control (C2) systems such as Counter-Unmanned Aircraft Systems and Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS) Traffic Management (UTM) Systems. At the onset, you will have opportunities to engage stakeholders to understand their needs, ideate the overall solution and architecture framework, and work with vendors to deliver solutions. With the implementation of the systems, you will manage the maintenance of the systems to ensure the highest level of serviceability throughout the life of the systems.
If this excites you, read on for details of the job responsibilities and requirements. We look forward to your application.
 Gather and analyse stakeholders’ operational requirements and ensure that the system software and architecture are designed and implemented in accordance with these requirements. Work with system provider on development of software architecture, technical designs, and specifications to support operational requirements expressed by stakeholders and following existing or industry best practice software development frameworks. Undertake project management activities including planning & budgeting, project tracking, prioritisation of features development, contract variation and change request management. Participate in system procurement activities including preparation of tender documentation, vendor evaluation and technical reviews Implementation and deployment of systems, including testing, commissioning, and software upgrade activities.
[What we are looking for]
 Trained in one of the following disciplines: Software Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent. Possess knowledge and experience on network infrastructure design, operation and deployment including, experience in system administration of Linux/VMware environment, database management (e.g. SQL) and understanding on management of network switches, firewalls and use of network management tools to monitor service metrics. Possess knowledge in software language such as Java, Kotlin. Possess knowledge of real time software development and safety critical systems. Understand and apply relevant policies from respective Code of Practises, guidelines and best practices (e.g. GovTech’s Instruction Manual for Infocomm Technology and Smart Systems, Center for Internet Security Benchmarks, etc.) during implementation of projects. Knowledge and experience in systems such as C2, RF transmitters, flying platforms, as well as frequency spectrum and communication theory is a plus. Prior experience working in an Operations Centre, in aviation industry, and/or in technical standards development (e.g. ASTM, EUROCAE, etc.) will be an added advantage. Calm disposition to handle and resolve unforeseen circumstances. Good analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication.
Note: Your appointment designation will commensurate with your relevant work experience. Successful candidates will be offered a 3-year contract in the first instance, and may be considered for placement on a permanent tenure or subsequent contract renewal.
Skills: Change Requests:Operational Oversight:Operational Requirements:Project Tracking:Safety-critical Systems:Serviceability:Supplier Evaluation:Technical Reviews:Tender Preparation:Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV)

Aon is in the business of better decisions
At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.
As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team, and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.
What The Day Will Look Like
The application developer role is principally responsible for the development and delivery of applications to the user base. Responsible for implementing and designing well-tested solutions for globally used applications specifically focused on the client facing activities . These activities involved include, but not limited to, API development, spatial development, UI/UX implementation, and other analytical solutions. The person in this role will also support the modernization and Cloud migration initiative for applications in the Analytics Solution service area.
As the application Developer some of your key responsibilities will involve:
Be an active participant during the solutioning with the senior developers/architects and assist in making technology choices that ensure project success.Play a hands-on role with development teams when applying coding practices to the architectural design ensuring success in delivering a quality product to users.Work alongside the Development Team Leads during the development process to ensure project design is being followed, assist in solving issues facing the team.Work alongside the Development Team to Manage and own the architectural design of new applications as well as new features within existing applications.Conduct discovery and lead software solution development using Azure Cloud.Take mentorship from the Reinsurance Architecture Community of Practice regarding the principles set forth around coding principles and other architectural practices to be applied to the Reinsurance business' suite of applications.
How This Opportunity Is Different
ACIA’s Climate Risk Advisory team is currently looking for an Application Developer to help empower results for our clients by delivering innovative and effective solutions as part to expand the delivery capabilities of our analytics solutions, which serves the needs of the firm’s clients and consultants worldwide. This role provides great exposure to the business, and the opportunity to take part in product development/implementation, training and support.
Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success
Experience in application development, implementation, application design and software architectureExperience in C# development, Azure Cloud, Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) and Microsoft SQL Server databasesAble to implement solutions while considering performance and maintainability of the codeBachelor's or Master's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or related technical fieldGood written and oral communication skillsCritical thinker and problem solverContinuous Integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) experienceExperience working in an agile software development environment
How We Support Our Colleagues
In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognise that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!
Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.
Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
Aon provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, domestic partner status, or other legally protected status.
We welcome applications from all and provide individuals with disabilities with reasonable adjustments to participate in the job application, interview process and to perform essential job functions once onboard. Job description:
As a Systems Engineer / Senior Systems Engineer, you will be part of a team that is responsible for ensuring the successful design, implementation, and testing of complex naval systems of systems.
You will work closely with multiple teams and suppliers to ensure the interoperability, compatibility, and functionality of multiple subsystems.
Key Responsibilities
Translate system level requirements and use cases into verifiable subsystem and component level requirements.Design, source, and integrate subsystems, and evaluate hardware and software solutions.Configure and test hardware and software components.Design and develop interfaces to ensure efficient integration of subsystems.Support in system design analysis in terms of reliability, availability, maintainability, and system safety.Develop and execute integration and test plans.Communicate with stakeholders to ensure alignment of requirements and use cases with system design and implementation.Develop and maintain technical documentation.
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.Strong analytical and trouble-shooting skills.Excellent communication skills, verbal and written, with the ability to effectively communicate technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work as a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

System/Network Administration
Oversee and upkeep the maintenance of Windows server, Microsoft AD, Outlook 365.
Administration and configuration of servers and network infrastructure comprising switches, routers, firewalls, and other components.
Establish/Setup network by evaluating network performance issues including availability, utilization, throughput and latency; defining network policies, firewall rules, and procedures.
Secure network by developing network access, monitoring, control, and evaluation; maintaining documentation.
Perform daily system monitoring, maintaining backup logs, verifying the integrity on hardware, server resources, and systems.
Perform ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required.
Cyber Security Support
Protects system by defining access privileges, control structures, and resources.
Recognizes problems by identifying abnormalities; reporting violations.
Implements security improvements by assessing current situation; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements.
Determines security violations and inefficiencies by conducting periodic audits and maintaining regular checks.
Maintains technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing publications.
L1/L2 Business Support
Maintain office equipment like personal computers, network, printers, and ops-related equipment.
Create, change, delete user accounts, and manage other IT requirements.
Develop, maintain, and document installation and configuration procedures.
Research and recommend innovation for new technologies.
Support L1 infrastructure needs whenever necessary.

Key Responsibilities
Experience of 8 to 12 years. Minimum experience of 8 years plus at least in SAP SDHands on experience on SAP SD with strong Basics Configurations, enhancements, interfaces, transactions, Report etc.Hands on experience on gathering business requirement, business analysis, Gap analysis, configuration, customizing interface objects, testing, user training, conducting workshops sessions, data migration, pre and post implementation support.Should have work at least in 3 support projects, rollout, implementation projects.Excellent skills and experience in project management, functional business analysis and development methodologies including Agile.Experience in global template preparations & rolloutsExcellent customer interaction skills and leadership qualities.Strong understanding on Integration between SD and other core modules like FICO/PS/MM.Good experience in configuration, defect management, testing, documentation, end user support in project cycleShould be able to design and configure business scenarios, and propose feasible solution to be implementedExperience in writing functional specifications for new developments / change requests.Day to Day monitoring of tickets and work towards closure.Experience in Testing - Test Plan, Test Case Specifications, Test Scenarios etc. for functionality testingShould be able to work as Individual contributor with excellent communication skills (verbal and written)Should be able to handle Projects, Changes Request independently.Should have excellent customer relationship skills to develop good rapport with Client.Quick learner and excellent analytical skills.Experience in manufacturing automotive industry preferred

iCompaz is a Joint Venture between Infosys Limited and Temasek Holdings, both global leaders in their respective industries, and the JV was created exclusively to bring Digital Transformation capabilities and global skills to the ASEAN market. Job description:
This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office.
Job Description
Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
Job Family Definition
Designs, develops, troubleshoots and debugs software programs for software enhancements and new products. Develops software including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases and Internet-related tools. Determines hardware compatibility and/or influences hardware design.
Management Level Definition
Applies developed subject matter knowledge to solve common and complex business issues within established guidelines and recommends appropriate alternatives. Works on problems of diverse complexity and scope. May act as a team or project leader providing direction to team activities and facilitates information validation and team decision making process. Exercises independent judgment within generally defined policies and practices to identify and select a solution. Ability to handle most unique situations. May seek advice in order to make decisions on complex business issues.
Responsibilities
Manage, support, and troubleshoot virtualized infrastructure and computer networksDeploy and manage monitoring tools of infrastructure performance, utilization, and healthAdopt & practise configuration management best practicesBuild and maintain automation tools for operation and maintenanceDocumenting processes, changes, incidents, and resolutions of the managed infrastructureCollaborates and communicates with internal and external partners regarding software system/network design status, project progress and issue resolution.
Knowledge And Skills
Good understanding of computer OS, networking, container platform and virtual machinesExperience in Production deployments and operationsAbility to apply analytical and problem-solving skills.Has good understanding in system architecturePreferably has experience using automation tools like ansiblePreferably has experience using monitoring and log management toolsGood written and verbal communication skills; mastery in EnglishAbility to effectively communicate design proposals and negotiate options.
Join us and make your mark!
We Offer
 A competitive salary and extensive social benefits Diverse and dynamic work environment Work-life balance and support for career development An amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it?
