Job description:
Singapore

Join our business aligned technology team in Singapore to build and extend the trading and risk systems for the Commodity Markets and Finance (CMF) division within the Commodities and Global Markets (CGM) group.

This is a great opportunity to work in a fast-paced trading environment and work closely with the front-office commodities trading and middle office teams, to translate requirements into optimal technical designs that make a tangible and critical difference to how we do business.

Your understanding of the complete software development lifecycle coupled with ability to write and test original code will help deliver efficient solutions. Additionally, providing support to traders and other business users on the applications the team develops and enhances, as a member of the DevOps team.

A strong aptitude for investment products or trading/risk platforms will set you apart, as well as the willingness to get involved across a range of technologies. With team-mates across the regions, Singapore, Sydney, UK; the role will also give you the opportunity to work with experienced developers around the world and grow with the team.

You will be responsible for:
Delivering solutions for dynamic and growing trading businesses that rely heavily on technology.Working as part of a team gathering requirements, designing and implementing new solutions and enhancements to existing platforms.Implementing software engineering best practices, including CI/CD techniques.Building automation and resilient solutions to improve efficiency of existing processes.Collaborating with other tech teams to facilitate digital transformation of businesses, new data strategy, and cloud migration.Providing technology coverage for support needs raised by aligned business teams. Also covering operational support for the technical solutions developed by the team.
You will have:
4+ years of experience in a similar role. Exposure to a front-office environment would be an advantage.Expertise in building and maintaining applications using C++ in a Linux environment.Good exposure to the Python ecosystem.Experience with SDLC tools and CI/CD environments (e.g. Git, Bitbucket, Bamboo, Jira, Confluence)Experience with SQL and RDBMS.Cloud skills (e.g. AWS) and container skills (Docker/Kubernetes) would be an advantage.Knowledge in financial markets, particularly in commodities trading business would be an advantage.Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, coupled with strong communication skills.Ability to work as part of a collaborative team.
About The Corporate Operations Group

The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Corporate Strategy & Solutions, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 

The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.

We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

About Macquarie

A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop new skills, explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition, helping sustain global food supplies, financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie, we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.

Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management, retail and business banking, wealth management, leasing and asset financing, market access, commodity trading, renewables development, specialist advisory, capital raising and principal investment.

Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers

About The Role
As a Pre-Sales Solutions Engineer at HashiCorp, you will work in a high performance team environment to drive business development and sales growth by providing technical expertise around Development Operations specifically in the context of multiple technical (development. operations, and security) and executive audiences.
In This Role You Can Expect To
Lead as a domain expert in Development Operations to the sales team and technical lead on strategic client relationships in large enterprises industry verticalsInvolved in pre-sales engineering activities including technical discovery, technical value proposition, architectural guidance, sales campaign support and ongoing client relationshipsAbility to provide expert guidance on Development Operations (DevOps) concepts with strong skill sets in infrastructure architecture, cloud, IT operations, security, and development technologies and processesEstablish and maintain a deep understanding of the overall HashiCorp technology portfolio and the competitive landscapeHelp foster an environment for ongoing strategic customer successWork closely with key client executive decision makers on product evaluations and proof of concepts to ensure the solutions/products meets client objectivesActively assist other Sales teams in pre-sales engineering responsibilities
You may be a good fit for our team if you have:
Technical Pre-Sales / Sales Engineering or Professional Services experience in a large and dynamic enterprise environmentProficiency in understanding concepts and technologies in DevOps, IT operations, security, cloud, microservices, containers, and scheduling platformsExperience with implementing software products or solutions in enterprise environment.Knowledge of existing HashiCorp tools such as Vagrant, Packer, Terraform, Consul, Nomad, Vault and others is desirableAbility to work well in a highly dynamic / team environment that focuses on providing above industry standard customer serviceB.S. degree in an engineering or similar program from an accredited college / university preferred Domestic and occasionally international travel required

Job description:
Responsibilities

As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of our CI/CD toolsuite. Your role will involve collaborating closely with software engineers to automate their deployments and enhance productivity. Additionally, you will work closely with enterprise architects and the IT security team to ensure compliance with their requirements. Troubleshooting deployment errors, performing root cause analysis, and implementing corrective actions will also be part of your responsibilities.

Requirements

To excel in this role, you should have 1-3 years of working experience as a DevOps Engineer or in a similar software engineering position. You should be well-versed in at least one CI/CD tool, such as Jenkins, Octopus, or ArgoCD. A solid understanding of CI/CD best practices, including environmental variable replacement strategies, is essential. Additionally, you should possess a good understanding of containerization tools like Docker and have experience working with image repositories. Knowledge of container orchestration tools, especially Kubernetes, will be considered a bonus.

Join our dynamic team as a DevOps Engineer and play a vital role in enhancing our software development and deployment processes. Your expertise in CI/CD tools and containerization will contribute to the overall efficiency and success of our projects. If you are passionate about continuous improvement and automation in software development, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Please send your resume in WORD format by clicking the apply button below or contact Maverick Khoo on +65 6701 1521 for a confidential discussion. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted. CEI Reg. Number R22105688 Khoo Teng Ming, Maverick.

Apply now

Job Title: Platforms Engineer, Platforms DX Team for AI Singapore
Industries: Higher Education:Education Administration Programs:Strategic Management Services
Job description:
Job Description

AI Singapore (AISG) is a national AI programme launched by the National Research Foundation (NRF) to anchor deep national capabilities in Artificial Intelligence (AI).

The programme office is hosted by the National University of Singapore (NUS) and brings together all Singapore-based research institutions and the vibrant ecosystem of AI start-ups and companies developing AI products to perform use-inspired research, grow the knowledge, create the tools, and develop the talent to power Singapore’s AI efforts.

Candidates will be expected to provide technical leadership, engage stakeholders independently, mentor junior engineers and apprentices, and contribute ideas to improve the system.

The Platforms Engineer will be responsible for developing and maintaining AI Singapore's hybrid infrastructure and platforms, integrating various technology and ensuring our ML teams can leverage the best tooling for their requirements. They will work within the Platforms Engineering Group, focusing on one of multiple Platforms teams: InfraOps, DataOps, MLOps, or Developer Experiences (DX), to improve AI/ML workflows and create integrations to on-prem and cloud infrastructures.

Duties & Responsibilities
Develop, maintain, and optimise our hybrid on-prem and cloud infrastructure, including on-prem HPC/AI Cluster, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, on-prem storage, and other platforms.Build developer platforms and integrations to streamline our ML engineering teams' utilisation of resources and tooling.Collaborate with the Platforms DX team to define requirements, design solutions, and ensure efficient development workflows.Participate in code and design reviews, and contribute to continuously improving our platforms' performance, usability, and developer experience.Mentor AISG apprentices in Platforms projects.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.Excellent communication skills, including thoughtful listening skills and the ability to express complex ideas clearly and succinctly.The ability to reason about engineering issues holistically using engineering fundamentals and knowledge about architecture.A systematic approach to development and engineering, such as debugging, DevOps and MLOps practices, and agile software development.Have held at least one engineering or infrastructure position for at least five years.Proficient in at least one commonly used programming language, such as Python, Ruby, Go, Rust, Javascript, Java, C#, etc. Proficiency in Python would be preferred.Proficient in administering Linux systems.Basic proficiency and understanding of machine learning concepts, including data analysis, predictive modelling and model evaluation.Proficiency in at least one automation tool (Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Bash, PowerShell, etc.).Familiarity with virtualisation technologies (KVM, VMWare, etc.).Familiarity with container and container orchestration technologies (Docker, Podman, Singularity, Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, Helm, etc.).Familiarity with public cloud providers such as AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud PlatformExperience with deployment of applications on cloud or distributed systems.An aptitude for automated system design and implementation (automated deployments and automated testing).
Folks with AICE Associate certification and above who exhibit aptitude and potential for the above skills are welcome to apply.

More Information

Location: Kent Ridge Campus

Organization: Office of the Deputy President(Res&Tech)

Department : AI Singapore

Employee Referral Eligible

Job requisition ID : 20262

Founded in 2019, Cake Group is a leading decentralised finance services provider and Southeast Asia’s fastest growing fintech platform. "We Do Crypto. You Do You." - Our vision is to become a one-stop platform for all crypto users to get easy access to DeFi and Web3 services. To date, more than 1 million users from over 190 countries trust us to manage over $1 billion in assets. We are a profitable, cashflow positive private rocket ship that's just getting ready for take-off. Join us.
About Birthday Research- Blockchain R&D Wing Of Cake DeFi
Birthday Research (BDR) is the Blockchain Research and Development wing of Cake DeFi, a Singapore-based blockchain, and fintech company. Fuelled by the best minds in the industry, BDR seeks to develop best-in-class blockchain innovations with the mission of enabling the next bound of Web3.
As a pioneering force, our work spans cryptographic research, deep blockchain consensus development, and smart contracts development — with a laser-sharp focus on driving the industry frontier while tackling the most demanding DeFi challenges of today. To date, one of our core contributions, DeFiChain, has garnered over 1 billion USD in total value locked on the layer-1 protocol.
We are a fast-growing, globally distributed, close-knit team of multi-disciplinary doers and getters. Join Birthday Research today to be a part of the driving force shaping the future of decentralization.
What You’ll Do
 Collaborate with cross-functional engineering and product teams to design and develop blockchain modules.  Take an active responsibility in designing and developing highly scalable blockchain modules for our scaling needs.  Write highly performant clean, simple, maintainable codes and battle-tested with test-driven development (TDD) for maximum test coverage automated from pull request all the way to release.  Taking on the polyglot hat and deep-diving into multiple codebases (Rust/C++/JS) to contribute and understand how things work under the hood.  Engineering low-level performant blockchain modules such as peer networking, ledger indexes, consensus protocol, and wallet systems. 

 What you’ll need:
 Experience working in a fast pace tech-driven startup as a Software Engineer with at least 2 years of experience or in a similar capacity.  Strong proficiency in TypeScript or JavaScript with experience working in Web, Node, or Mobile technologies.  Ability to take full ownership and work independently while collaborating with others in a fast-paced agile and async team.  A collaborative and resourceful individual with excellent communication skills able to make radical decisions while being empathetic and respectful.  Willingness to pick up new and emerging bleeding edge blockchain technologies.  A deep technical understanding of blockchain technologies, cryptography, BIPs, DeFi, UTXO, EVM, or Nakamoto Consensus is highly preferred. 

 Why work with Cake:
Do something with purpose; Be a part of the future that will shape on how people are dealing with their finances in Crypto and BlockchainFast moving, challenging and unique business problemsInternational, diverse work environment and flat hierarchyGreat career development opportunities in a growing companyCompetitive salaryFlexible working hours, unlimited discretionary leave, casual work attire
We want to transform and decentralise finance with tomorrow’s technology. This is where you come in. Join a company that is at the forefront of bleeding-edge innovations in blockchain and DeFi. You will be empowered to push boundaries and think out of the box. You will get to work with a bunch of ridiculously motivated and talented people. And most importantly, you'll have fun. The best places to work at, are often also the most fun to work at. That's us.
We hire based on merit, fit, and strong alignment to our culture. Our culture is defined by 7 team principles: Integrity, Resourcefulness, Ownership, Meritocratic Decision-making, Customer Obsession, Radical Candour, and Passion. These 7 principles guide our company, our people, and our work. At Cake Group, our culture is our pride. It has been instrumental to our success, so we are steadfast in our commitment to it. We welcome you to add to it.
Skills: Blockchain:C++:JavaScript:Polyglot:Rust (Programming Language):Test Coverage:Test-Driven Development

Job description:
Summary
 
Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. Together we create products and experiences people once couldn’t have envisioned — and now can’t imagine living without. If you’re excited by the idea of making an impact, joining a team where we pride ourselves in being one of the most diverse and expansive companies in the world, a career with Apple might be your dream job!


We are looking for a Software engineer, with an appropriate balance of experience and interest in software development to join our Global Network Services (GNS) team supporting our infrastructure around the globe.

 
Key Qualifications
 
Exposure to various programming languages such as Python/Java/Ruby/Perl/Go with proficiency in at least one language.

Experience with designs incorporating aspects of security, high availability, and resiliency into solutions

Experience building/maintaining RESTful APIs

Experience with CI/CD tools and techniques

Experience with application and service monitoring

Working knowledge of network protocols and Linux/Unix system internals and transport protocols (TCP/IP, TLS, HTTP, UDP)

Project management / documentation proficiency for task tracking, specifications, diagrams, standards documentation, operating procedures, test plans/reports, etc.

Excellent communications skills with the ability to establish and maintain collaboration with partners; capable of working with multi-functional technical / business teams including varying levels of management, in a professional manner

Experience operating and developing infrastructure and services in cloud platforms a plus.

Working knowledge of Network operating systems (i.e. Junos, IOS, EOS) a plus.

Experience with centralized configuration management and provisioning technologies, such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef etc. a plus.

 
Description
 
Based in Singapore, the position will work with extended team members located both in the US and Europe to develop tools/solutions for our Operations teams to continually improve on our key operational metrics of reliability/visibility and efficiency. This individual will need to excel in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment, collaborating closely with our network operations teams, as well as cross-functionally with external groups to deliver turn-key solutions in order to reach this goal. Due to the nature of our customer, foundational network technology knowledge will be a key for the ideal candidate to possess.

 
Additional Requirements
 
Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Ability to take full ownership and work independently while collaborating with others in a fast-paced agile and async team.  A collaborative and resourceful individual with excellent communication skills able to make radical decisions while being empathetic and respectful.  Willingness to pick up new and emerging bleeding edge blockchain technologies.  A deep technical understanding of blockchain technologies, cryptography, BIPs, DeFi, UTXO, EVM, or Nakamoto Consensus is highly preferred. 

 Why work with Cake:
Do something with purpose; Be a part of the future that will shape on how people are dealing with their finances in Crypto and BlockchainFast moving, challenging and unique business problemsInternational, diverse work environment and flat hierarchyGreat career development opportunities in a growing companyCompetitive salaryFlexible working hours, unlimited discretionary leave, casual work attire
We want to transform and decentralise finance with tomorrow’s technology. This is where you come in. Join a company that is at the forefront of bleeding-edge innovations in blockchain and DeFi. You will be empowered to push boundaries and think out of the box. You will get to work with a bunch of ridiculously motivated and talented people. And most importantly, you'll have fun. The best places to work at, are often also the most fun to work at. That's us.
We hire based on merit, fit, and strong alignment to our culture. Our culture is defined by 7 team principles: Integrity, Resourcefulness, Ownership, Meritocratic Decision-making, Customer Obsession, Radical Candour, and Passion. These 7 principles guide our company, our people, and our work. At Cake Group, our culture is our pride. It has been instrumental to our success, so we are steadfast in our commitment to it. We welcome you to add to it.

Job description:
Summary
 
Apple is a place where extraordinary people gather to do their best work. Together we create products and experiences people once couldn’t have envisioned — and now can’t imagine living without. If you’re excited by the idea of making an impact, joining a team where we pride ourselves in being one of the most diverse and expansive companies in the world, a career with Apple might be your dream job!


We are looking for a Software engineer, with an appropriate balance of experience and interest in software development to join our Global Network Services (GNS) team supporting our infrastructure around the globe.

 
Key Qualifications
 
Exposure to various programming languages such as Python/Java/Ruby/Perl/Go with proficiency in at least one language.

Experience with designs incorporating aspects of security, high availability, and resiliency into solutions

Experience building/maintaining RESTful APIs

Experience with CI/CD tools and techniques

Experience with application and service monitoring

Working knowledge of network protocols and Linux/Unix system internals and transport protocols (TCP/IP, TLS, HTTP, UDP)

Project management / documentation proficiency for task tracking, specifications, diagrams, standards documentation, operating procedures, test plans/reports, etc.

Excellent communications skills with the ability to establish and maintain collaboration with partners; capable of working with multi-functional technical / business teams including varying levels of management, in a professional manner

Experience operating and developing infrastructure and services in cloud platforms a plus.

Working knowledge of Network operating systems (i.e. Junos, IOS, EOS) a plus.

Experience with centralized configuration management and provisioning technologies, such as Ansible, Puppet, Chef etc. a plus.

 
Description
 
Based in Singapore, the position will work with extended team members located both in the US and Europe to develop tools/solutions for our Operations teams to continually improve on our key operational metrics of reliability/visibility and efficiency. This individual will need to excel in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment, collaborating closely with our network operations teams, as well as cross-functionally with external groups to deliver turn-key solutions in order to reach this goal. Due to the nature of our customer, foundational network technology knowledge will be a key for the ideal candidate to possess.

 
Additional Requirements
 
Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Job description:
About UOB

United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values – Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.

About The Department

Job Responsibilities

Job Requirements

Be a part of UOB Family

UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Apply now and make a difference.

We are looking for engineers to power Hudson River Trading's continued expansion into global markets. As an engineer based out of our Singapore office, you will play a critical role in the process of establishing HRT's presence in Asia-Pacific markets and work closely with our algo and operations teams to ensure the continued success of our trading. You will also be deeply involved in the continuous, ongoing process of optimizing trading in markets HRT already has a presence in.

In this role, you'll be expected to own the process of entering new markets and manage market changes over time. With this responsibility, you'll gain broad exposure to both the technical and business aspects of our trading operation. It is difficult to overstate the impact of this role - you will immediately contribute to the bottom line as HRT begins trading in markets it previously had no presence in and HRT’s trading in existing markets becomes more profitable.

Profile
In your spare time you: code, tinker, read, explore, break things, and have an insatiable curiosity for all things computer related... you'll find like-minded people here.You possess a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related fieldYou are capable of working independently as well as part of a teamYou can analyze and fix problems quicklyCan look at code, figure out how it works, and how to make it betterCan describe software designs at a high level (the abstract interface), low level (step-by-step algorithm), or anywhere in betweenYou really like to work with people who challenge you and make you better at what you do 
Qualifications
C++ experience requiredFamiliarity with UNIX operating systems and comfort at a command lineMust be fluent (reading, writing and conversing) in EnglishAdept at working independently and in self-managementExperience developing market data and order entry systems a plus
Culture

Hudson River Trading (HRT) brings a scientific approach to trading financial products. We have built one of the world's most sophisticated computing environments for research and development. Our researchers are at the forefront of innovation in the world of algorithmic trading.

At HRT we welcome a variety of expertise: mathematics and computer science, physics and engineering, media and tech. We’re a community of self-starters who are motivated by the excitement of being at the cutting edge of automation in every part of our organization—from trading, to business operations, to recruiting and beyond. We value openness and transparency, and celebrate great ideas from HRT veterans and new hires alike. At HRT we’re friends and colleagues – whether we are sharing a meal, playing the latest board game, or writing elegant code. We embrace a culture of togetherness that extends far beyond the walls of our office.

Feel like you belong at HRT? Our goal is to find the best people and bring them together to do great work in a place where everyone is valued. HRT is proud of our diverse staff; we have offices all over the globe and benefit from our varied and unique perspectives. HRT is an equal opportunity employer; so whoever you are we’d love to get to know you.

Job description:
We are searching for a System Engineer to be part of our diverse team here in Glamco. Our System Engineers are key component of our operations by providing technical support, testing, installation, training, support and maintenance services for our programs in Singapore. In addition, the System Engineer shall support the Program / Project Manager on the project and system maintenance life cycle from pre-sales to maintenance.
Candidates must show initiative, highly independent, hands-on, aspiration for increase role and responsibilities, and a demonstrated willingness to work in a team.
Job Responsibilities
Reporting to the Program / Project Manager, the System Engineer will be using their expertise and experience to support both internal Glamco and external Customer activities for our Singapore commercial program. Specific responsibilities but not limited to the following includes:
 Provide system engineering and networking support to our programs in Singapore including but not limited to hardware and software configuration and set up, troubleshooting networks and system defects, and fielding technical questions about hardware and software Manage and provide onsite and remote customer support including system and infrastructure installation, configuration, testing, training, maintenance, site-surveys etc Provide system engineering and networking expertise to our programs in Singapore during pre-sales and post-sales Develop, prepare and conduct test cases for customer’s program Develop and maintain technical and configuration documentation, training materials and user manuals Serve as a Technical Support expert and capable of handling escalations, incidents, outages and infrastructure challenges. Evaluate and upgrade system hardware and/or firmware with consultation with program partners. Perform system patching and deployment. Lead and manage a team of Technical Officers to provide technical and maintenance support to clients Support the Program / Project Manager to manage the project and system maintenance lifecycle from Proposal development to Project Kickoff to Initial Design to Development and Testing to Customer Acceptance Testing to System Maintenance Program Support the Business Development Team in determining project scope of work Ensure project and maintenance SLA (Service Level Agreement) and customer satisfaction levels are met Maintain standard operating procedures (SOP), processes and guidelines Maintain security, backup and redundancy strategies Research new technologies and solution in support of the programs Any other technical, operations or project related duties that may be required
Requirements
 Diploma or Degree in Information Technology or Computer Engineering or related field Minimum of 3 years working experience in IT Support, Network, Systems, Cyber Security type function Knowledge or experience with network and system administration including firewall and network infrastructure topology, networking protocols, routing and switching, and firewall configuration Knowledge or experience with server and workstation administration Checkpoint Firewalls, PaloAlto Firewalls, Fortinet Firewall, Cisco Switches, HP Aruba Switches, VPN Technologies, DNS, NTP, 2 Factor Authentication technologies Experience in running projects are plus points Strong interest and experience in the field of Radar and Radio Frequency (RF) technologies are plus points Good English and Mandarin interpersonal, oral and written communications skills are required Hardware, software and technical aptitude Strong analytical and critical thinking skills Show initiative, self-discipline, excellent judgment, career aspirations for increased role and responsibilities, a demonstrated willingness to work as a team with the ability to work independently Willing to perform potential shift duties, weekends and overtime Willing to travel overseas to support overseas requirements Willing to work in an SME environment Must possess Class 3 Manual driving license Singaporean only
About Glamco
GLAMCO Aviation Pte Ltd (GLAMCO) prides itself as a leading solutions provider for the Aerospace, Commercial, Air & Maritime Traffic Management and Defence & Security industries. Established in Singapore since 195, GLAMCO provides component repair and overhaul, spares support, specialized products and other related consultancy services to Aircraft operators, Defence and Security agencies, Civil Airport and Seaport Operators.
Representing Aircraft Manufacturers, Systems OEMs, Stocking Distributors and OEMs worldwide, we are able to support Programme Management, quick response and delivery. GLAMCO has also expanded its activities to include the supply of specialized equipment for the Navy, Army, as well as Civil Airport and Seaport. Since 2020s,
GLAMCO has further expanded our services to provide logistics management (warehouse), system engineering and maintenance support to our customers.
To learn more about us and our products, please visit our website at www.glamco.com.sg.
If you are ready to make an impact, email your contact information and current resume to: freddie.goh@glamco.com.sg. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Nice to meet you! We are Ascenda.
Ascenda provides the rewards infrastructure for leading financial services brands across the world. Our clients include the world’s largest banks, top tier card issuers and fintechs who utilise our rewards infrastructure to power their earn & burn rewards programs. These include American Express, CapitalOne, HSBC, Brex, Virgin Money, SMBC, ICBC, Bradesco, ANZ, HDFC and Top 10 financial services brands in many other countries. With a best-in-class technology suite and the world’s broadest rewards content marketplace, we are the engine behind winning premium rewards propositions for financial services all around the globe. Our clients are spread across continents, and we serve over 1 billion customers globally. No matter where you are in the world, you’ll recognize our footprint! We believe that nothing should stand in the way of companies who strive to drive growth via compelling and effortless rewards propositions that their customers love. Welcome to the future of customer growth. Join us as we shape the future of rewards in financial services!
We’re looking for a passionate DevOps Engineer who is keen to learn, grow and bring his/her experience in a fast-paced environment. We’re a small team of 5 nice and (we think) fun folks.
We follow a full DevOps approach. Our infrastructure is managed as code using Terraform. Our services run on Kubernetes, in multiple AWS accounts across several regions. CI/CD, code and vulnerabilities scans… are fully automated. We work closely with the developers and the security teams.
In a typical DevOps day we use Terraform, Istio, Git, Kubectl, Jenkins, Helm, Grafana, Cloudflare, Redshift… to name a few.
We focus on automation, quality, and we achieved compliance with the most stringent security standards (PCI-DSS, SOC2, ISO27001).
Our partners are financial institutions and airlines, and they expect a very high level of availability, reliability and security.
Job Description:
We’re looking for a senior profile with a true passion for DevOps, systems, automation, security, with several years of professional experience in technologies similar to the ones we use. As a senior member of the DevOps team, you would:
Propose and implement improvements related to scalability, automation, performance, CI/CD, security of platforms and data. We are absolutely looking forward to your suggestions!Improve our API gateway, Services Mesh, Events streaming, data warehouse…Improve our observability stack, if you are into Grafana, Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, Graylog, Loki.Help the whole team to grow in skills and experience.
We expect you to have:
Knowledge in Linux, Kubernetes, Terraform, CI/CD.Experience with cloud service providers such as AWS, Azure, etc.Knowledge and interest in automation, configuration and infrastructure management tools.Knowledge in scripting and writing small utilities (shell, Python, Golang, etc.)Knowledge and interest in systems and platforms security, observability, databases, networking, etc.Good communication skills, ability to work in the team
We have a rewarding working place that provides a:
High growth environment & exponential career developmentMobile & flexible work environmentCompetitive compensationTravel perks & Employee rewards
We welcome candidates who are authorized to work in Singapore or Vietnam (Ho Chi Minh).
Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS):Application Monitoring:CI:Communication:Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD):DevOps:Graylog:Prometheus.io:Scalability:Software Development

Job description:
Company OverviewKiteworks’ mission is to empower organizations to effectively manage risk in every send, share, receive, and save of sensitive content. To this end, we created a platform that delivers content governance, compliance, and protection to customers. The platform unifies, tracks, controls, and secures sensitive content moving within, into, and out of their organization, significantly improving risk management and ensuring regulatory compliance on all sensitive content communication. Kiteworks is carrying its bold vision forward while maintaining strong profitability and growth. This is a perfect time to join the company as it moved into a high growth phase and there are many opportunities to make a meaningful contribution to its future.

The RoleWe are hiring a Senior DevOps Engineer position to be based in Singapore. We are looking for highly driven, talented and self-motivated Engineers to join a team of world-class engineers. Priority will be given to Singaporean and Singapore PR holders. 
What You Will DoDevelop and implement new tools to streamline manual operations and processes.Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines, integrating testing and monitoring frameworks to enable rapid and continuous software delivery.Collaborate with software developers, quality assurance engineers and IT professionals to guarantee smooth build and release process.Conduct root cause analysis, resolve and implement long term fixes.Design, implement, and maintain scalable and reliable infrastructure solutions in On-premise ( VmWare ) and cloud environments ( Amazon , Azure ).Continuously assess and improve system reliability, security, and performance through proactive monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions.Prepare and maintain technical documentation.

What You Bring With You 5 years of experience in SRE / DevOps, system engineering, build/release/deployment and automation.Strong Linux skills.Demonstrated ability to program using a high-level programming language or scripting (Python, Golang, Java, , Shell).Experience implementing applications in private / public cloud infrastructure and container technologies.Experience with public cloud (AWS, Azure) platforms through migrations, scaling and day-to-day operations.Knowledge in source control management such as Git, Gitlab and CI/CD tools like Jenkins or similar.Experience with configuration management tools (Ansible, Terraform).Experience in logging, monitoring, tracing with tools like Cloudwatch, Zabbix, Elasticsearch/Kibana (ELK).Good understanding of the DB technologies SQL and NOSQL such as MongoDB,MySQL and PostgreSQL..Understand networking protocols and services, such as SFTP, DHCP, DNS, VLANs, etc. Routing will be an added advantage.Good to have knowledge of static analysis and testing tools, such as JUnit, Pylint, PyTest, etc.Strong desire to drive automation in software development, implementation and deployment

Bonus Points if you :Are passionate about Continuous Build, Integration, Test and Delivery SystemsHave a strong understanding of Opensource / Enterprise vulnerability scanners.Have excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills in a complex Unix/Linux systems environment application implementations.Have a strong desire to drive automation in software development, implementation and deployment
EducationBachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, IT-related fields, or a related, technical discipline.Polytechnic Diploma holders with strong work experience are invited to apply
Work EnvironmentKiteworks has a very dynamic and flexible work culture and we’re looking for driven, resourceful, and proactive thinkers to solve complex technical challenges.
Compensation/Perks:You’ll be rewarded with a competitive compensation package including excellent benefits and stock options. Other benefits include: medical, dental, 18 days of annual leave going up to 21 days after 3 years.

Job Highlights
Attractive Compensation & BenefitJoining a growing company in a growing industryGood and Positive working culture
Position Overview
As a Senior Full Stack Devops Developer, you will be a key member of the development team, responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining complex web applications. You will contribute to all stages of the software development lifecycle, from gathering requirements and designing architecture to implementing features and ensuring high-quality code. Your deep understanding of both front-end and back-end technologies will enable you to provide technical guidance, mentorship, and make architectural decisions. You will also play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and maintaining robust and scalable infrastructure solutions to support the development and deployment of software applications. You will be responsible for creating and managing efficient development workflows, ensuring smooth integration between development and operations teams, and automating processes to streamline software delivery. Additionally, you will contribute to the architectural decisions and provide technical leadership to the team.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with stakeholders, including product managers, designers, and other developers, to gather and analyze requirements, and translate them into technical specifications and implementation plans.Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient web applications, both on the front-end and back-end, using appropriate technologies, frameworks, and programming languages.Implement user interfaces with a focus on usability, responsiveness, and cross-browser compatibility, using modern front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.Develop server-side logic and APIs using back-end technologies like Node.js, Django, or Java, ensuring robustness, security, and high performance.Design and optimize databases, including data modeling, querying, and performance tuning, using SQL or NoSQL databases.Ensure code quality and maintainability through code reviews, testing, and adherence to coding standards and best practices.Provide technical guidance, mentorship, and support to junior developers, fostering their growth and helping them improve their skills.Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, working closely with team members to identify root causes and implement effective solutions.Contribute to the documentation of code, architecture, and processes to facilitate collaboration, maintain knowledge, and support future development efforts.Create and manage infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like Ansible and Terraform to automate provisioning, configuration, and deployment of infrastructure resources.Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or Azure DevOps to enable continuous integration, delivery, and deployment of software applications.Monitor and optimize the performance, availability, and scalability of the application infrastructure, including servers, databases, and networking components.Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure and deployment issues, perform root cause analysis, and implement preventive measures to minimize future incidents.Implement security best practices and ensure compliance with relevant standards and regulations throughout the development and deployment process.Stay up to date with industry trends and emerging technologies related to DevOps and software development, and evaluate their potential to enhance existing systems and processes.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Equivalent work experience may be considered.Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer, DevOps Engineer, or similar role, with a strong focus on building and maintaining infrastructure for web-based applications.Proficiency in multiple programming languages, such as Java, Python, JavaScript, or GO Lang, and experience with modern web frameworks (e.g., Laravel, React, or Node.js).Strong understanding of cloud computing platforms, such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, and experience with deploying applications in cloud environments.Expertise in infrastructure automation and configuration management tools, such as Terraform and Ansible.Hands-on experience with containerization technologies like Docker and container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes.In-depth knowledge of CI/CD concepts and experience with implementing CI/CD pipelines using tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or Azure DevOps.Solid understanding of networking principles, database management systems, and server administration (Linux/Unix and/or Windows).Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools like Prometheus, Grafana, ELK stack, or Splunk for infrastructure and application performance monitoring.Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to analyze complex systems and identify practical solutions.Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Proven ability to provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guide the team in implementing best practices and industry standards.

Responsibilities
Responsible for providing support on maintenance project.Responsible for handling system administration, network support, implementation, troubleshooting in Windows / Linux / Unix.

Min Diploma in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science/ Information Technology or equivalent.Min 2 years of working experience in managing LAN / WAN / Routers / Switches / DNS / Firewall and Milestone System

Job description:
We’re looking for a System Engineer
As a System Engineer, you join a squad of talented engineers and support them with the technical implementation of DataMiner projects for our users. You are a contact for the users on all technical matters, enabling smooth collaboration between them and the different departments within Skyline.
At Skyline, we're all about agility. It's a necessary mindset delivering continuity in these fast-changing times. Iterative increments, close collaboration, cross-functional and self-organizing teams, and short feedback loops are just some of the Agile ways of working you'll experience while working with us.
LET’S GET DOWN TO BUSINESS
A glimpse of.your [future]
Transparency is a key value here at Skyline. So let's forget about empty job titles or colorful descriptions for a moment and take a look at what you'd actually be doing here.
You will acquire and maintain detailed knowledge of all DataMiner features.You will help building key solutions which are globally recognized and usedYou will become a customer’s contact for technical matters related to your projectsYou will have to fully understand all aspects related to the functional and technical specifications of your projectsYou guarantee the efficient implementation of all technical aspects of the projectsYou will troubleshoot all technical solution issues that affect project deliveryYou will perform quality assurance from functional perspective on all technical features in your projectsYou will create and maintain all required project documentation for acceptance, hand-over, and internal presentation proceduresYou will help to collect user stories of the customer and where required start discussions with other teams/departments
What skills.do you require?
Let's dig a bit deeper into the various technical skills you'll need to get started as a System Engineer.
Experience with markup languages (XML)Knowledge of communication protocols in general, such as SNMP, HTTP or serialKnowledge of databasing (e.g., Apache Cassandra, Elasticsearch)Knowledge of TCP/IP networking, multithreading, Web Services (REST, SOAP), and JSON is a definite plusKnowledge of C# is a plusInterest in the telecom and broadcast industry (e.g. HFC broadband, IPTV, broadcast, cable, satellite systems…)
Your [competencies]
You'll be working in a highly technical environment prone to constant change and evolution. On top of that, you'll have to collaborate with a great many (marvelous) people. All very exciting! But it also calls for a special kind of mind- and skillset.
You are a fast learner and adapt quickly to new situationsYou have a positive can-do attitude and are a team playerYou are communicative and have effective interpersonal and organizational skillsYou think logically and always keep the client’s needs in mindYou have natural technical insight and are passionate about the benefits of software technologyYou can work independently and prioritize tasksYou have good verbal and written communications skills in EnglishYou have a bachelor’s, master’s or doctorate degree in ICT, Software and/or Telecom
Our Benefits
What's in.it [for you]
Well-being & health
Your health & happiness are our number one priority. From ergonomic office spaces to prime health insurance plans, we’ve got you covered.
Postive impact
We are dedicated to making a lasting impact on the future, from local community initiatives to company-wide environmental programs.
Money & benefits
We offer financial peace of mind through competitive compensation and benefits like a mobile allowance.
Personal growth
Your future is really important to us. That’s why we support your personal development with continuous training & growth opportunities.
Flexibility & balance
You get the flexibility to work when & where you want. Or take time off when you need it. Because who knows you better than … you?
Close-knit community
We’ve got your back. You can always count on your fellow Skyliners for a helping hand, a good talk, and amazingly fun team events.

Job description:
This position is to carry out all technical and service duties as directed by the Service Manager in a professional and safe manner, and to provide support and establish a good relationship with internal and external customers in order to achieve high customer satisfaction.
Adecco is partnering with an international leader in the fields of medical and safety technology.
Responsibilities
Support start-up, contract maintenance and other service activities with emphasis on safety and protection.Perform routine preventive and corrective maintenance of company's safety product.Participate in field and in-house service and repair of gas detection system, warranty repair, safety activities, emergency response, breakdown calls and ad hoc projects.Manage all orders efficiently until fulfilment stage, by working closely within the Service team.Liaison with relevant parties such as customers, service supervisor, coordinators and logistic pertaining to queries, technical issues, status and deliveries.Ensure equipment turnaround and breakdown responses are achieved at optimal level of efficiency.Effective communication of technical information to employees, customers and external parties in an accurate and concise manner in both written and verbal media.Carry out service work in accordance to relevant safety requirements.To provide support to other duties that may be assigned in the course of work.To participate / take up Workplace Safety & Health responsibilities / activities as per requested by the company.

NTC 2 or Diploma in Electrical/Electronic/Electro-Mechanical Engineering.Preferably with 3 - 5 years' experience in service/engineering position in similar industry. Process instrumentation experience is an added advantage.Good analytical, troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Must be open to weekend or odd hours work when required.Customer oriented.Team player.Able to work from height and in confined space when required.Intermediate Computer Skills in MS Word, Excel and Outlook.Possess Class 3 driving license.

Job description:
Overview
The resource personnel assigned must be a certified Storage (SAN) and Backup Administrator in administration and troubleshooting, in a 24x7 enterprise setting (inclusive of manual discovery or post actions from automatic alerts).
He/She Is Expected To Cover Level 1 And Level 2 Storage Related Problems And Must Be An Experienced Administrator In The Following Technologies
 IBM V3700 and V7000 EMC unity or EMC VNX NETAPP storage HP Nimble or any Dell storages Hitachi storage EMC Isilon or any NAS product Cisco or Brocade san switches NETBACKUP or Veeam IBM tape libraries
Duties & Responsibilities
Storage Area Network (SAN)
Provide Installation, administration and maintenance support for Storage Area Network and Enterprise Backup.Health check and monitoring of the storage devices.Integrate the storage solution’s hardware and software into the customer’s operating environment and ensure full interoperability.Regularly update the firmware.Ensure comprehensive documentation of the storage solution is in place.Prepare test plan in consultation with the customer to ensure the solution can function fully.Enterprise Backup.Backup job configuration and scheduling.Backup server performance tuning.Administration and management of Symantec backup environment.Troubleshoot any backup related.Manage and monitor multiple storage subsystem.Manage disk partitioning.Manage the storage capacity and utilisation.LUN assignments (create, modify or delete LUN of various sizes).Creation and management of Zones.Conduct capacity planning and performance tuning.Define and configure security within the storage subsystem.Maintaining or troubleshooting the zones and switch related issues.Upgrading the SAN switches.Capacity planning for tape libraries and backup servers.Perform Disaster Recovery (DR) for all the critical systems and ensure successful rebuilt of Production or DR servers after each DR should the need arise.
Requirements
Recognized Diploma/Degree in Information Technology/Information Systems/Computer Science, Business IT or other equivalent university degree.At least 3 years’ experience in Enterprise Backup Solutions and Storage Area Network.Experience supporting Singapore government agencies with security clearance.Experience in power cycling the storage devices.Working experience on storage replication is good to have.Experience data centre shutdown activities.Experience in DR exercises
Skills: Backup Solutions:Capacity Planning:Consultation:Disaster Recovery:Firmware:Interoperability:Storage Area Network (SAN):Storage Devices:Systems Engineering:Test Planning

Job description:
Company Overview
Kiteworks’ mission is to empower organizations to effectively manage risk in every send, share, receive, and save of sensitive content. To this end, we created a platform that delivers content governance, compliance, and protection to customers. The platform unifies, tracks, controls, and secures sensitive content moving within, into, and out of their organization, significantly improving risk management and ensuring regulatory compliance on all sensitive content communication. Kiteworks is carrying its bold vision forward while maintaining strong profitability and growth. This is a perfect time to join the company as it moved into a high growth phase and there are many opportunities to make a meaningful contribution to its future.
The Role
We are hiring a Senior DevOps Engineer position to be based in Singapore. We are looking for highly driven, talented and self-motivated Engineers to join a team of world-class engineers. Priority will be given to Singaporean and Singapore PR holders.
What You Will Do
Develop and implement new tools to streamline manual operations and processes.Develop and maintain CI/CD pipelines, integrating testing and monitoring frameworks to enable rapid and continuous software delivery.Collaborate with software developers, quality assurance engineers and IT professionals to guarantee smooth build and release process.Conduct root cause analysis, resolve and implement long term fixes.Design, implement, and maintain scalable and reliable infrastructure solutions in On-premise ( VmWare ) and cloud environments ( Amazon , Azure ).Continuously assess and improve system reliability, security, and performance through proactive monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions.Prepare and maintain technical documentation.
What You Bring With You
5 years of experience in SRE / DevOps, system engineering, build/release/deployment and automation.Strong Linux skills.Demonstrated ability to program using a high-level programming language or scripting (Python, Golang, Java, , Shell).Experience implementing applications in private / public cloud infrastructure and container technologies.Experience with public cloud (AWS, Azure) platforms through migrations, scaling and day-to-day operations.Knowledge in source control management such as Git, Gitlab and CI/CD tools like Jenkins or similar.Experience with configuration management tools (Ansible, Terraform).Experience in logging, monitoring, tracing with tools like Cloudwatch, Zabbix, Elasticsearch/Kibana (ELK).Good understanding of the DB technologies SQL and NOSQL such as MongoDB ,MySQL and PostgreSQL ..Understand networking protocols and services, such as SFTP, DHCP, DNS, VLANs, etc. Routing will be an added advantage.Good to have knowledge of static analysis and testing tools, such as JUnit, Pylint, PyTest, etc.Strong desire to drive automation in software development, implementation and deployment
Bonus Points If You
Are passionate about Continuous Build, Integration, Test and Delivery SystemsHave a strong understanding of Opensource / Enterprise vulnerability scanners.Have excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills in a complex Unix/Linux systems environment application implementations.Have a strong desire to drive automation in software development, implementation and deployment
Education
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, IT-related fields, or a related, technical discipline.Polytechnic Diploma holders with strong work experience are invited to apply
Work Environment
Kiteworks has a very dynamic and flexible work culture and we’re looking for driven, resourceful, and proactive thinkers to solve complex technical challenges.
Compensation/Perks
You’ll be rewarded with a competitive compensation package including excellent benefits and stock options. Other benefits include: medical, dental, 18 days of annual leave going up to 21 days after 3 years.
Location: Singapore / On-site / Flexible Work arrangements
Skills: Amazon CloudWatch:Amazon Web Services (AWS):DevOps:NoSQL:Open-Source Software:Root Cause:Root Cause Analysis:Site Reliability Engineering:Technical Documentation:Zabbix

Ensure cloud environment complies with relevant industry standards and regulations.Monitor the performance and availability of cloud resources, identifying potential issues and optimizing the infrastructure to ensure optimal performance.Leverage automation tools and scripting languages to automate routine tasks, such as provisioning and scaling cloud resources.Collaborate with other teams to integrate cloud services into applications and ensure smooth operations. Role:Providing maintenance and operation support for Data Center Common Infrastructure involves ensuring the smooth functioning, availability, and reliability of the fundamental components that make up a data center’s infrastructure. This includes hardware, server resources, systems, and various key processes that are critical for the proper operation of the data center.  The responsibilities of this role include the following:Assessing and Implementing Changes: The individual is responsible for assessing and implementing Service Requests (SR) and Change Requests (CR) within the specified Service Level Agreements (SLAs). This could involve making necessary adjustments, configurations, or changes to the infrastructure based on the requests.Providing Documentation and Reports: The role involves creating and maintaining supporting documentation, reports, and information related to the maintenance and operation of the data center infrastructure. This documentation helps management and other stakeholders understand the status and health of the infrastructure.Monitoring and Verifying Integrity: The individual is tasked with monitoring and verifying the integrity and availability of all hardware components, server resources, systems, and essential processes. This includes regularly reviewing system and application logs to identify any anomalies or issues.System Software Management: The person ensures that the system software, including the operating system and associated software, is always operational. This involves managing updates, patches, and configurations to ensure the software components are functioning properly.Problem and Incident Resolution: The role requires assisting in the resolution of problems and incidents that may arise within the data center infrastructure. This could involve diagnosing issues, troubleshooting, and determining the root cause of problems to implement effective solutions.Collaboration with Vendors and Service Providers: The individual works closely with equipment vendors, service providers, system integrators, and other relevant parties to analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve system-related problems. This collaboration is essential for restoring the infrastructure to an operational state.Security and Vulnerability Management: The role involves staying informed about new vulnerabilities released by equipment and software vendors. The person is responsible for promptly notifying the customer about these vulnerabilities and working to obtain updates and patches. After testing, the updates and patches are implemented to address security concerns.Standby Support: The role requires being available for standby support 24/7, meaning the person should be ready to respond to emergencies or issues that may arise outside regular working hours.Off-Peak Hours Work: The individual is expected to work during off-peak hours to carry out scheduled system activities. This ensures that maintenance, updates, and changes can be performed without disrupting the normal operations of the data center during peak usage times. Required skills:Good Knowledge of Windows Server or Redhat Linux (min 3–5 years experience).
Skills: Change Requests:Data Center Infrastructure:Knowledge Acquisition:Linux:Red Hat Linux:Service-Level Agreements (SLA):Troubleshooting:Vulnerability Management:Windows Server

Job description:
[What the role is]
The Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB), a government agency under the Ministry of Trade and Industry, is responsible for strategies that enhance Singapore’s position as a global centre for business, innovation, and talent. We undertake investment promotion and industry development, and work with international businesses, both foreign and local, by providing information, connection to partners and access to government incentives for their investments. Our mission is to create sustainable economic growth, with vibrant business and good job opportunities for Singapore.
About The Information Technology (IT) Division, EDB
Our IT Division works in close partnership with EDB’s business divisions to drive digital transformation. We build digital products that leverage technology to improve EDB’s operational efficiency, create exceptional customer experience and deliver enhanced business value for EDB. We thrive on teamwork, and form cross functional teams of product managers, designers and engineers who work hand in hand to develop solutions for our organisation and customers.
The Platform Engineer develops, administers, supports, improves and optimises platforms that support the application development lifecycle and have the relevant knowledge and experience in the various automation tools for developing DevOps pipeline (CI/CD).
He works with developers and Product teams on code releases and support the team by providing recommendations to improve software development & deployment through process re-engineering, scripting & automation.
He is curious, has a thirst for continuous learning and is eager to work as part of a team to develop and optimise platforms. He is personable and interacts and communicates his views to others in the team with ease.
The official title for this role would be Software Engineer.
[What you will be working on]
Identify, develop, implement, maintain, administer, support and improve IT infrastructure and CI/CD platform that are used to support application development lifecycle.Collaborate with the Product Team to onboard new product to the platform and to improve the existing application development process.Collaborate with Infosec Team on implementing security best practices on the applications, IT infrastructure and CI/CD platform.Collaborate internally within DevOps Team as well as with other teams to improve IT infrastructure, CI/CD platform and processes used for application development lifecycle.Own, recover and improve from incidents.Manage procurement, from issuing requirements until award.Manage implementation projects outsourced to external vendors.Develop policies, procedures and tools that manage changes to IT infrastructure and CI/CD platform.Share the knowledge and know-how to others; work with other team members to adopt and improve DevOps culture.Manage and provision hosting environments through code and implement tools to do so.
[What we are looking for]
Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in installing, configuring and troubleshooting the following tools:
Operating system: Linux (Ubuntu) and MS WindowsScripting: Bash, PowerShell, PerlRepository and Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery: GitLab, MS VSTS, GitTesting tool: SeleniumContainer/Container Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes, AKSLogging/Telemetry: Elasticsearch, Splunk, PrometheusVisualisations: Kibana, GrafanaSecurity: Checkmarx, ClairWeb Server: Nginx, MS IIS, TomcatInfrastructure as Code: Ansible, Terraform, PuppetDatabase: Redis, MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, MariaDBPlatform-as-a-Service: VMWare/Pivotal PKSCloud: AWS
In Addition To The Above, You Will Require
Knowledge in networking protocols and services (e.g. SFTP, DHCP, VLANs, routing, load balancer, etc) with hands-on experience troubleshooting network issues.Hands-on experience with application development using agile methodology. Experience in deploying micro-service application.Knowledge of various open source technologies.Good team player and communicator, with strong analytical and problem-solving abilitiesBackground in Computer Engineering/Computer Science Bachelor's degree preferred, candidate who demonstrate strong relevant experience and skill sets will be considered.Certifications in the above-mentioned tools on point 1, DevOps and/or application development using agile methodology would be advantageous. Good system troubleshooting skills.Only Singaporeans may apply
We review applications and interview on a rolling basis. Applicants can expect to receive an application outcome within 8 weeks of application date

About CSIT
CSIT develops products to advance the national security interests of Singapore. We use our products in a wide range of use-cases, including but not limited to Counter-terrorism and Computer Network Defence.
Software product development is an involved process. Our product teams need to be well supported with an integrated platform and infrastructure that enable them to deliver software quickly and efficiently. We are looking for talented and experienced software engineers that are passionate about developer experience to lead, build, and expand this foundational platform that improves our developers’ productivity.
Role
As a senior software engineer in our dynamic platform team, you will play a key part in the development and maintenance of software toolchain, services, and automation on our cloud infrastructure to aid our engineers in software development. You will be an engineers’ engineer, collaborating closely with product teams to ensure an excellent software development experience.
Responsibilities
Design, build, and maintain features and automation for our developer platform, which includes a range of cloud services and APIs used by our developers to build and deploy exciting applicationsWork with engineers across our entire software development stack to improve software delivery performanceCollaborate with other platform and infra teams to ensure seamless integration between our developer platform and other services in our private cloudLead deep technical discussion with the team to solve complex problemsMaintain a high standard of code quality and ensure best practices are followedTake an engineer’s approach to operational work, developing software to optimise our platform and eliminating work through automation
Requirements (Minimum Qualifications)
Bachelor's degree in computer science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experienceAt least 5 years of experience in software development using one or more general purpose programming languages (e.g. Python, Java, Go)Experience working with containerization technologies such as Docker or KubernetesFamiliarity with API design principles, and experience building and maintaining APIsExcellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to work independently or as part of a team
Nice-to-haves
At least one year of experience working on developer facing systems, cloud services, infrastructure automation or in a DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) roleAt least one year of experience in a technical leadership roleExperience in the design and operation of large-scale distributed systems
As CSIT is an agency under the Ministry of Defence (Singapore), only Singapore Citizens will be considered.
Skills: Cloud Infrastructure:Software Development:Technical Leadership

About The Company

Our client is one of the market leaders in the innovative tech solutions industry, with an array of world class products. They have a well established presence of more than 20 years with more than 10,000 employees globally. With Rapid expansion plans, they are now looking for an Site Reliability Engineer (AWS), to be a part of their team.

About The Job

As a Site Reliability Engineer (AWS), your responsibility involves:
Facilitating Cloud CI/CD release process using tools and technologies such as Jenkins / Terraform.Performing cloud resources provisioning, this includes configuration through Command Line Interface or API.Performing monitoring activities while implementing metrics, this can include working with docker container technologies.Participating in service impact incidents and providing resolutions, this includes root cause analysis and post-mortem discussions.
Skills And Experience Required

As a successful candidate, you should have at least 3 years of working experience in a Devops / Cloud related role with working knowledge of AWS Serverless technologies, services, or infrastructure architecture.

You should also have a good experience with CI/CD release processes and container related technologies.

Whats on Offer

This is an exciting opportunity to join a Global MNC as their Site Reliability Engineer (AWS). Being part of the Global HQ IT team, you will get to work on CI/CD, Latest Cloud Software developments projects initiated from Singapore to be driven across global operations in the areas of Cloud and Automation.

Job description:
Job Description
Configuration & Release ManagementResponsible for building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure utilizing Knowledge in continuous integration, delivery, and deployment (CI/CD), Cloud technologies, Container Orchestration and Security. Build and test end-to-end CI/CD pipelines, ensuring that systems are safe against security threats.

About Us
We are growing our Robotics team at Dyson to deliver an expanding range of innovative, intelligent and connected Robotic Products. If you are passionate about delivering the best product for customers, enabling teams to excel and developing individuals to perform at their best and achieve their career goals, then we would love to hear from you.
About The Role
Design and develop embedded software for production consumer products on a range of silicon platforms, mainly ARM based MCU/MPUManage the entire life cycle of multiple related complex modules and systems, including requirement alignment, software design, coding, testing, documentation, release, maintenance and result tracking, manufacturing test/verification methodologyInvolve in continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) infrastructure/environment setupKeen focus on product performance and test automation efficiency. In-depth participation in cross-teams product design discussions will be required. 
About you

A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Engineer, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar.8+ years of work experience in embedded system development.Good command of C/C++ programming language is essential.Good knowledge of MCU/MPU architecture and its common peripherals such as WiFi, BLE, NFC, ZigBee and camera.Excellent knowledge of Operating Systems such as Linux and RTOSExperience in board bring up, Linux BSP and RTOS integration is essential.Experience with debug tool like GDB, Linux driver development and testing experience is highly desired.Experience in automated testing and manufacturing test process is highly desired.Excellent object-oriented programming (OOP) capability, including speed and overall quality; preferably, the candidate shall be able to write high performance product quality code with both C and modern C++.Familiar with STL, boost C++ libraries, design patterns and able to enforce it in day-to-day tasks is a plus.Strong proficiency in multithreading programming and synchronisation mechanisms.Proficient in scripting languages, such as Python and Bash.Experience in fulfilling continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline setup.Experience of safety software development (MISRA, IEC standards, etc) is advantage. Experience of interfaces such as UART, I2C, SPI, MIPI.Experience in sensors modules integration and calibration is plus.Low level debugging experience, such as by JLink, Oscilloscope, etc. is a plus.Experience in Agile practices is a plus.Professionalism and excellent communication skills, ability to communicate complex information at every level.Fluent in spoken and written English 
Benefits

Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.
Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.
